         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Life and Death of King John</h1>
         </header>

                           </span>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.7">6. SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.8">7. SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">KING JOHN</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PRINCE HENRY, son to the king.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ARTHUR, Duke of Bretagne, nephew to the king.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">The Earl of PEMBROKE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">The Earl of ESSEX</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">The Earl of SALISBURY</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">The Lord BIGOT</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">HUBERT DE BURGH</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ROBERT FAULCONBRIDGE, Son to Sir Robert Faulconbridge. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PHILIP the BASTARD, his half-brother. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">JAMES GURNEY, servant to Lady Faulconbridge. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PETER Of Pomfret, a prophet. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PHILIP, King of France. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LEWIS, the Dauphin.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LYMOGES, Duke of AUSTRIA. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CARDINAL PANDULPH, the Pope's legate.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">MELUN, a French Lord.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CHATILLON, ambassador from France to King John.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">QUEEN ELINOR, mother to King John.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">CONSTANCE, mother to Arthur.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BLANCH of Spain, niece to King John. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LADY FAULCONBRIDGE</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Lords, Citizens of Angiers, Sheriff, Heralds, Officers, Soldiers, Messengers, and other Attendants.</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Partly in England, and partly in France.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  KING JOHN'S palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  KING JOHN'S palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING JOHN, QUEEN ELINOR, PEMBROKE, ESSEX,
SALISBURY, and others, with CHATILLON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, say, Chatillon, what would France with us?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHATILLON</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus, after greeting, speaks the King of France</div>
                     <div class="line">In my behavior to the majesty,</div>
                     <div class="line">The borrow'd majesty, of England here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">A strange beginning: 'borrow'd majesty!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Silence, good mother; hear the embassy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHATILLON</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip of France, in right and true behalf</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thy deceased brother Geffrey's son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Arthur Plantagenet, lays most lawful claim</div>
                     <div class="line">To this fair island and the territories,</div>
                     <div class="line">To Ireland, Poictiers, Anjou, Touraine, Maine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Desiring thee to lay aside the sword</div>
                     <div class="line">Which sways usurpingly these several titles,</div>
                     <div class="line">And put these same into young Arthur's hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy nephew and right royal sovereign.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What follows if we disallow of this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHATILLON</div>
                     <div class="line">The proud control of fierce and bloody war,</div>
                     <div class="line">To enforce these rights so forcibly withheld.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Here have we war for war and blood for blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Controlment for controlment: so answer France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHATILLON</div>
                     <div class="line">Then take my king's defiance from my mouth,</div>
                     <div class="line">The farthest limit of my embassy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear mine to him, and so depart in peace:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be thou as lightning in the eyes of France;</div>
                     <div class="line">For ere thou canst report I will be there,</div>
                     <div class="line">The thunder of my cannon shall be heard:</div>
                     <div class="line">So hence! Be thou the trumpet of our wrath</div>
                     <div class="line">And sullen presage of your own decay.</div>
                     <div class="line">An honourable conduct let him have:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pembroke, look to 't. Farewell, Chatillon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt CHATILLON and PEMBROKE</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">What now, my son! have I not ever said</div>
                     <div class="line">How that ambitious Constance would not cease</div>
                     <div class="line">Till she had kindled France and all the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the right and party of her son?</div>
                     <div class="line">This might have been prevented and made whole</div>
                     <div class="line">With very easy arguments of love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which now the manage of two kingdoms must</div>
                     <div class="line">With fearful bloody issue arbitrate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Our strong possession and our right for us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Your strong possession much more than your right,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else it must go wrong with you and me:</div>
                     <div class="line">So much my conscience whispers in your ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which none but heaven and you and I shall hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Sheriff</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ESSEX</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, here is the strangest controversy</div>
                     <div class="line">Come from country to be judged by you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That e'er I heard: shall I produce the men?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them approach.</div>
                     <div class="line">Our abbeys and our priories shall pay</div>
                     <div class="line">This expedition's charge.</div>
                     <p>Enter ROBERT and the BASTARD</p>
                     <div class="line">What men are you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Your faithful subject I, a gentleman</div>
                     <div class="line">Born in Northamptonshire and eldest son,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I suppose, to Robert Faulconbridge,</div>
                     <div class="line">A soldier, by the honour-giving hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Coeur-de-lion knighted in the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What art thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">The son and heir to that same Faulconbridge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that the elder, and art thou the heir?</div>
                     <div class="line">You came not of one mother then, it seems.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Most certain of one mother, mighty king;</div>
                     <div class="line">That is well known; and, as I think, one father:</div>
                     <div class="line">But for the certain knowledge of that truth</div>
                     <div class="line">I put you o'er to heaven and to my mother:</div>
                     <div class="line">Of that I doubt, as all men's children may.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Out on thee, rude man! thou dost shame thy mother</div>
                     <div class="line">And wound her honour with this diffidence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I, madam? no, I have no reason for it;</div>
                     <div class="line">That is my brother's plea and none of mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">The which if he can prove, a' pops me out</div>
                     <div class="line">At least from fair five hundred pound a year:</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven guard my mother's honour and my land!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">A good blunt fellow. Why, being younger born,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth he lay claim to thine inheritance?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not why, except to get the land.</div>
                     <div class="line">But once he slander'd me with bastardy:</div>
                     <div class="line">But whether I be as true begot or no,</div>
                     <div class="line">That still I lay upon my mother's head,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that I am as well begot, my liege,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair fall the bones that took the pains for me!--</div>
                     <div class="line">Compare our faces and be judge yourself.</div>
                     <div class="line">If old sir Robert did beget us both</div>
                     <div class="line">And were our father and this son like him,</div>
                     <div class="line">O old sir Robert, father, on my knee</div>
                     <div class="line">I give heaven thanks I was not like to thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what a madcap hath heaven lent us here!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath a trick of Coeur-de-lion's face;</div>
                     <div class="line">The accent of his tongue affecteth him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you not read some tokens of my son</div>
                     <div class="line">In the large composition of this man?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Mine eye hath well examined his parts</div>
                     <div class="line">And finds them perfect Richard. Sirrah, speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">What doth move you to claim your brother's land?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Because he hath a half-face, like my father.</div>
                     <div class="line">With half that face would he have all my land:</div>
                     <div class="line">A half-faced groat five hundred pound a year!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">My gracious liege, when that my father lived,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your brother did employ my father much,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, by this you cannot get my land:</div>
                     <div class="line">Your tale must be how he employ'd my mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">And once dispatch'd him in an embassy</div>
                     <div class="line">To Germany, there with the emperor</div>
                     <div class="line">To treat of high affairs touching that time.</div>
                     <div class="line">The advantage of his absence took the king</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the mean time sojourn'd at my father's;</div>
                     <div class="line">Where how he did prevail I shame to speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">But truth is truth: large lengths of seas and shores</div>
                     <div class="line">Between my father and my mother lay,</div>
                     <div class="line">As I have heard my father speak himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">When this same lusty gentleman was got.</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon his death-bed he by will bequeath'd</div>
                     <div class="line">His lands to me, and took it on his death</div>
                     <div class="line">That this my mother's son was none of his;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if he were, he came into the world</div>
                     <div class="line">Full fourteen weeks before the course of time.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, good my liege, let me have what is mine,</div>
                     <div class="line">My father's land, as was my father's will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, your brother is legitimate;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your father's wife did after wedlock bear him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And if she did play false, the fault was hers;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which fault lies on the hazards of all husbands</div>
                     <div class="line">That marry wives. Tell me, how if my brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, as you say, took pains to get this son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had of your father claim'd this son for his?</div>
                     <div class="line">In sooth, good friend, your father might have kept</div>
                     <div class="line">This calf bred from his cow from all the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">In sooth he might; then, if he were my brother's,</div>
                     <div class="line">My brother might not claim him; nor your father,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being none of his, refuse him: this concludes;</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother's son did get your father's heir;</div>
                     <div class="line">Your father's heir must have your father's land.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ROBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall then my father's will be of no force</div>
                     <div class="line">To dispossess that child which is not his?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Of no more force to dispossess me, sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than was his will to get me, as I think.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether hadst thou rather be a Faulconbridge</div>
                     <div class="line">And like thy brother, to enjoy thy land,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or the reputed son of Coeur-de-lion,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord of thy presence and no land beside?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, an if my brother had my shape,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I had his, sir Robert's his, like him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And if my legs were two such riding-rods,</div>
                     <div class="line">My arms such eel-skins stuff'd, my face so thin</div>
                     <div class="line">That in mine ear I durst not stick a rose</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest men should say 'Look, where three-farthings goes!'</div>
                     <div class="line">And, to his shape, were heir to all this land,</div>
                     <div class="line">Would I might never stir from off this place,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would give it every foot to have this face;</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not be sir Nob in any case.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">I like thee well: wilt thou forsake thy fortune,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bequeath thy land to him and follow me?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am a soldier and now bound to France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, take you my land, I'll take my chance.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your face hath got five hundred pound a year,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet sell your face for five pence and 'tis dear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I'll follow you unto the death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, I would have you go before me thither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Our country manners give our betters way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What is thy name?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip, my liege, so is my name begun,</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip, good old sir Robert's wife's eldest son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">From henceforth bear his name whose form thou bear'st:</div>
                     <div class="line">Kneel thou down Philip, but rise more great,</div>
                     <div class="line">Arise sir Richard and Plantagenet.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother by the mother's side, give me your hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">My father gave me honour, yours gave land.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now blessed by the hour, by night or day,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was got, sir Robert was away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">The very spirit of Plantagenet!</div>
                     <div class="line">I am thy grandam, Richard; call me so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, by chance but not by truth; what though?</div>
                     <div class="line">Something about, a little from the right,</div>
                     <div class="line">In at the window, or else o'er the hatch:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who dares not stir by day must walk by night,</div>
                     <div class="line">And have is have, however men do catch:</div>
                     <div class="line">Near or far off, well won is still well shot,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I am I, howe'er I was begot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, Faulconbridge: now hast thou thy desire;</div>
                     <div class="line">A landless knight makes thee a landed squire.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, madam, and come, Richard, we must speed</div>
                     <div class="line">For France, for France, for it is more than need.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother, adieu: good fortune come to thee!</div>
                     <div class="line">For thou wast got i' the way of honesty.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt all but BASTARD</p>
                     <div class="line">A foot of honour better than I was;</div>
                     <div class="line">But many a many foot of land the worse.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, now can I make any Joan a lady.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Good den, sir Richard!'--'God-a-mercy, fellow!'--</div>
                     <div class="line">And if his name be George, I'll call him Peter;</div>
                     <div class="line">For new-made honour doth forget men's names;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis too respective and too sociable</div>
                     <div class="line">For your conversion. Now your traveller,</div>
                     <div class="line">He and his toothpick at my worship's mess,</div>
                     <div class="line">And when my knightly stomach is sufficed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then I suck my teeth and catechise</div>
                     <div class="line">My picked man of countries: 'My dear sir,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus, leaning on mine elbow, I begin,</div>
                     <div class="line">'I shall beseech you'--that is question now;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then comes answer like an Absey book:</div>
                     <div class="line">'O sir,' says answer, 'at your best command;</div>
                     <div class="line">At your employment; at your service, sir;'</div>
                     <div class="line">'No, sir,' says question, 'I, sweet sir, at yours:'</div>
                     <div class="line">And so, ere answer knows what question would,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saving in dialogue of compliment,</div>
                     <div class="line">And talking of the Alps and Apennines,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Pyrenean and the river Po,</div>
                     <div class="line">It draws toward supper in conclusion so.</div>
                     <div class="line">But this is worshipful society</div>
                     <div class="line">And fits the mounting spirit like myself,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he is but a bastard to the time</div>
                     <div class="line">That doth not smack of observation;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so am I, whether I smack or no;</div>
                     <div class="line">And not alone in habit and device,</div>
                     <div class="line">Exterior form, outward accoutrement,</div>
                     <div class="line">But from the inward motion to deliver</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet, sweet, sweet poison for the age's tooth:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, though I will not practise to deceive,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, to avoid deceit, I mean to learn;</div>
                     <div class="line">For it shall strew the footsteps of my rising.</div>
                     <div class="line">But who comes in such haste in riding-robes?</div>
                     <div class="line">What woman-post is this? hath she no husband</div>
                     <div class="line">That will take pains to blow a horn before her?</div>
                     <p>Enter LADY FAULCONBRIDGE and GURNEY</p>
                     <div class="line">O me! it is my mother. How now, good lady!</div>
                     <div class="line">What brings you here to court so hastily?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY FAULCONBRIDGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is that slave, thy brother? where is he,</div>
                     <div class="line">That holds in chase mine honour up and down?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">My brother Robert? old sir Robert's son?</div>
                     <div class="line">Colbrand the giant, that same mighty man?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it sir Robert's son that you seek so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY FAULCONBRIDGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Robert's son! Ay, thou unreverend boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Robert's son: why scorn'st thou at sir Robert?</div>
                     <div class="line">He is sir Robert's son, and so art thou.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">James Gurney, wilt thou give us leave awhile?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GURNEY</div>
                     <div class="line">Good leave, good Philip.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip! sparrow: James,</div>
                     <div class="line">There's toys abroad: anon I'll tell thee more.</div>
                     <p>Exit GURNEY</p>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I was not old sir Robert's son:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Robert might have eat his part in me</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon Good-Friday and ne'er broke his fast:</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Robert could do well: marry, to confess,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could he get me? Sir Robert could not do it:</div>
                     <div class="line">We know his handiwork: therefore, good mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom am I beholding for these limbs?</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir Robert never holp to make this leg.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY FAULCONBRIDGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou conspired with thy brother too,</div>
                     <div class="line">That for thine own gain shouldst defend mine honour?</div>
                     <div class="line">What means this scorn, thou most untoward knave?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Knight, knight, good mother, Basilisco-like.</div>
                     <div class="line">What! I am dubb'd! I have it on my shoulder.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, mother, I am not sir Robert's son;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have disclaim'd sir Robert and my land;</div>
                     <div class="line">Legitimation, name and all is gone:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, good my mother, let me know my father;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some proper man, I hope: who was it, mother?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY FAULCONBRIDGE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou denied thyself a Faulconbridge?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">As faithfully as I deny the devil.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LADY FAULCONBRIDGE</div>
                     <div class="line">King Richard Coeur-de-lion was thy father:</div>
                     <div class="line">By long and vehement suit I was seduced</div>
                     <div class="line">To make room for him in my husband's bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven lay not my transgression to my charge!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art the issue of my dear offence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which was so strongly urged past my defence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by this light, were I to get again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, I would not wish a better father.</div>
                     <div class="line">Some sins do bear their privilege on earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so doth yours; your fault was not your folly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Needs must you lay your heart at his dispose,</div>
                     <div class="line">Subjected tribute to commanding love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against whose fury and unmatched force</div>
                     <div class="line">The aweless lion could not wage the fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor keep his princely heart from Richard's hand.</div>
                     <div class="line">He that perforce robs lions of their hearts</div>
                     <div class="line">May easily win a woman's. Ay, my mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart I thank thee for my father!</div>
                     <div class="line">Who lives and dares but say thou didst not well</div>
                     <div class="line">When I was got, I'll send his soul to hell.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, lady, I will show thee to my kin;</div>
                     <div class="line">And they shall say, when Richard me begot,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou hadst said him nay, it had been sin:</div>
                     <div class="line">Who says it was, he lies; I say 'twas not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  France. Before Angiers.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  France. Before Angiers.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter AUSTRIA and forces, drums, etc. on one side:
on the other KING PHILIP and his power; LEWIS,
ARTHUR, CONSTANCE and attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Before Angiers well met, brave Austria.</div>
                     <div class="line">Arthur, that great forerunner of thy blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Richard, that robb'd the lion of his heart</div>
                     <div class="line">And fought the holy wars in Palestine,</div>
                     <div class="line">By this brave duke came early to his grave:</div>
                     <div class="line">And for amends to his posterity,</div>
                     <div class="line">At our importance hither is he come,</div>
                     <div class="line">To spread his colours, boy, in thy behalf,</div>
                     <div class="line">And to rebuke the usurpation</div>
                     <div class="line">Of thy unnatural uncle, English John:</div>
                     <div class="line">Embrace him, love him, give him welcome hither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">God shall forgive you Coeur-de-lion's death</div>
                     <div class="line">The rather that you give his offspring life,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shadowing their right under your wings of war:</div>
                     <div class="line">I give you welcome with a powerless hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">But with a heart full of unstained love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Welcome before the gates of Angiers, duke.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">A noble boy! Who would not do thee right?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thy cheek lay I this zealous kiss,</div>
                     <div class="line">As seal to this indenture of my love,</div>
                     <div class="line">That to my home I will no more return,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till Angiers and the right thou hast in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Together with that pale, that white-faced shore,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose foot spurns back the ocean's roaring tides</div>
                     <div class="line">And coops from other lands her islanders,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even till that England, hedged in with the main,</div>
                     <div class="line">That water-walled bulwark, still secure</div>
                     <div class="line">And confident from foreign purposes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even till that utmost corner of the west</div>
                     <div class="line">Salute thee for her king: till then, fair boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will I not think of home, but follow arms.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, take his mother's thanks, a widow's thanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till your strong hand shall help to give him strength</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a more requital to your love!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The peace of heaven is theirs that lift their swords</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a just and charitable war.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Well then, to work: our cannon shall be bent</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the brows of this resisting town.</div>
                     <div class="line">Call for our chiefest men of discipline,</div>
                     <div class="line">To cull the plots of best advantages:</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll lay before this town our royal bones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wade to the market-place in Frenchmen's blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">But we will make it subject to this boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay for an answer to your embassy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest unadvised you stain your swords with blood:</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord Chatillon may from England bring,</div>
                     <div class="line">That right in peace which here we urge in war,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then we shall repent each drop of blood</div>
                     <div class="line">That hot rash haste so indirectly shed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CHATILLON</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">A wonder, lady! lo, upon thy wish,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our messenger Chatillon is arrived!</div>
                     <div class="line">What England says, say briefly, gentle lord;</div>
                     <div class="line">We coldly pause for thee; Chatillon, speak.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CHATILLON</div>
                     <div class="line">Then turn your forces from this paltry siege</div>
                     <div class="line">And stir them up against a mightier task.</div>
                     <div class="line">England, impatient of your just demands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath put himself in arms: the adverse winds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose leisure I have stay'd, have given him time</div>
                     <div class="line">To land his legions all as soon as I;</div>
                     <div class="line">His marches are expedient to this town,</div>
                     <div class="line">His forces strong, his soldiers confident.</div>
                     <div class="line">With him along is come the mother-queen,</div>
                     <div class="line">An Ate, stirring him to blood and strife;</div>
                     <div class="line">With her her niece, the Lady Blanch of Spain;</div>
                     <div class="line">With them a bastard of the king's deceased,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the unsettled humours of the land,</div>
                     <div class="line">Rash, inconsiderate, fiery voluntaries,</div>
                     <div class="line">With ladies' faces and fierce dragons' spleens,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have sold their fortunes at their native homes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Bearing their birthrights proudly on their backs,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make hazard of new fortunes here:</div>
                     <div class="line">In brief, a braver choice of dauntless spirits</div>
                     <div class="line">Than now the English bottoms have waft o'er</div>
                     <div class="line">Did nearer float upon the swelling tide,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do offence and scath in Christendom.</div>
                     <p>Drum beats</p>
                     <div class="line">The interruption of their churlish drums</div>
                     <div class="line">Cuts off more circumstance: they are at hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">To parley or to fight; therefore prepare.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">How much unlook'd for is this expedition!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">By how much unexpected, by so much</div>
                     <div class="line">We must awake endavour for defence;</div>
                     <div class="line">For courage mounteth with occasion:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let them be welcome then: we are prepared.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING JOHN, QUEEN ELINOR, BLANCH, the BASTARD,
Lords, and forces</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace be to France, if France in peace permit</div>
                     <div class="line">Our just and lineal entrance to our own;</div>
                     <div class="line">If not, bleed France, and peace ascend to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whiles we, God's wrathful agent, do correct</div>
                     <div class="line">Their proud contempt that beats His peace to heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace be to England, if that war return</div>
                     <div class="line">From France to England, there to live in peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">England we love; and for that England's sake</div>
                     <div class="line">With burden of our armour here we sweat.</div>
                     <div class="line">This toil of ours should be a work of thine;</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou from loving England art so far,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou hast under-wrought his lawful king</div>
                     <div class="line">Cut off the sequence of posterity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out-faced infant state and done a rape</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the maiden virtue of the crown.</div>
                     <div class="line">Look here upon thy brother Geffrey's face;</div>
                     <div class="line">These eyes, these brows, were moulded out of his:</div>
                     <div class="line">This little abstract doth contain that large</div>
                     <div class="line">Which died in Geffrey, and the hand of time</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall draw this brief into as huge a volume.</div>
                     <div class="line">That Geffrey was thy elder brother born,</div>
                     <div class="line">And this his son; England was Geffrey's right</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is Geffrey's: in the name of God</div>
                     <div class="line">How comes it then that thou art call'd a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">When living blood doth in these temples beat,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which owe the crown that thou o'ermasterest?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">From whom hast thou this great commission, France,</div>
                     <div class="line">To draw my answer from thy articles?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">From that supernal judge, that stirs good thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">In any breast of strong authority,</div>
                     <div class="line">To look into the blots and stains of right:</div>
                     <div class="line">That judge hath made me guardian to this boy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Under whose warrant I impeach thy wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">And by whose help I mean to chastise it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, thou dost usurp authority.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Excuse; it is to beat usurping down.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is it thou dost call usurper, France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me make answer; thy usurping son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Out, insolent! thy bastard shall be king,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou mayst be a queen, and cheque the world!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">My bed was ever to thy son as true</div>
                     <div class="line">As thine was to thy husband; and this boy</div>
                     <div class="line">Liker in feature to his father Geffrey</div>
                     <div class="line">Than thou and John in manners; being as like</div>
                     <div class="line">As rain to water, or devil to his dam.</div>
                     <div class="line">My boy a bastard! By my soul, I think</div>
                     <div class="line">His father never was so true begot:</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be, an if thou wert his mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">There's a good mother, boy, that blots thy father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">There's a good grandam, boy, that would blot thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear the crier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What the devil art thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">One that will play the devil, sir, with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">An a' may catch your hide and you alone:</div>
                     <div class="line">You are the hare of whom the proverb goes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose valour plucks dead lions by the beard;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll smoke your skin-coat, an I catch you right;</div>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, look to't; i' faith, I will, i' faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, well did he become that lion's robe</div>
                     <div class="line">That did disrobe the lion of that robe!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">It lies as sightly on the back of him</div>
                     <div class="line">As great Alcides' shows upon an ass:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, ass, I'll take that burthen from your back,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or lay on that shall make your shoulders crack.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What craker is this same that deafs our ears</div>
                     <div class="line">With this abundance of superfluous breath?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Lewis, determine what we shall do straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Women and fools, break off your conference.</div>
                     <div class="line">King John, this is the very sum of all;</div>
                     <div class="line">England and Ireland, Anjou, Touraine, Maine,</div>
                     <div class="line">In right of Arthur do I claim of thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Wilt thou resign them and lay down thy arms?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">My life as soon: I do defy thee, France.</div>
                     <div class="line">Arthur of Bretagne, yield thee to my hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And out of my dear love I'll give thee more</div>
                     <div class="line">Than e'er the coward hand of France can win:</div>
                     <div class="line">Submit thee, boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Come to thy grandam, child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Do, child, go to it grandam, child:</div>
                     <div class="line">Give grandam kingdom, and it grandam will</div>
                     <div class="line">Give it a plum, a cherry, and a fig:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's a good grandam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Good my mother, peace!</div>
                     <div class="line">I would that I were low laid in my grave:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not worth this coil that's made for me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">His mother shames him so, poor boy, he weeps.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Now shame upon you, whether she does or no!</div>
                     <div class="line">His grandam's wrongs, and not his mother's shames,</div>
                     <div class="line">Draws those heaven-moving pearls from his poor eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which heaven shall take in nature of a fee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, with these crystal beads heaven shall be bribed</div>
                     <div class="line">To do him justice and revenge on you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou monstrous slanderer of heaven and earth!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou monstrous injurer of heaven and earth!</div>
                     <div class="line">Call not me slanderer; thou and thine usurp</div>
                     <div class="line">The dominations, royalties and rights</div>
                     <div class="line">Of this oppressed boy: this is thy eld'st son's son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Infortunate in nothing but in thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy sins are visited in this poor child;</div>
                     <div class="line">The canon of the law is laid on him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being but the second generation</div>
                     <div class="line">Removed from thy sin-conceiving womb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Bedlam, have done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">I have but this to say,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is not only plagued for her sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">But God hath made her sin and her the plague</div>
                     <div class="line">On this removed issue, plague for her</div>
                     <div class="line">And with her plague; her sin his injury,</div>
                     <div class="line">Her injury the beadle to her sin,</div>
                     <div class="line">All punish'd in the person of this child,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all for her; a plague upon her!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou unadvised scold, I can produce</div>
                     <div class="line">A will that bars the title of thy son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, who doubts that? a will! a wicked will:</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman's will; a canker'd grandam's will!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, lady! pause, or be more temperate:</div>
                     <div class="line">It ill beseems this presence to cry aim</div>
                     <div class="line">To these ill-tuned repetitions.</div>
                     <div class="line">Some trumpet summon hither to the walls</div>
                     <div class="line">These men of Angiers: let us hear them speak</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose title they admit, Arthur's or John's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Trumpet sounds. Enter certain Citizens upon the walls</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Who is it that hath warn'd us to the walls?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis France, for England.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">England, for itself.</div>
                     <div class="line">You men of Angiers, and my loving subjects--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">You loving men of Angiers, Arthur's subjects,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our trumpet call'd you to this gentle parle--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">For our advantage; therefore hear us first.</div>
                     <div class="line">These flags of France, that are advanced here</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the eye and prospect of your town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Have hither march'd to your endamagement:</div>
                     <div class="line">The cannons have their bowels full of wrath,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ready mounted are they to spit forth</div>
                     <div class="line">Their iron indignation 'gainst your walls:</div>
                     <div class="line">All preparation for a bloody siege</div>
                     <div class="line">All merciless proceeding by these French</div>
                     <div class="line">Confronts your city's eyes, your winking gates;</div>
                     <div class="line">And but for our approach those sleeping stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">That as a waist doth girdle you about,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the compulsion of their ordinance</div>
                     <div class="line">By this time from their fixed beds of lime</div>
                     <div class="line">Had been dishabited, and wide havoc made</div>
                     <div class="line">For bloody power to rush upon your peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">But on the sight of us your lawful king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who painfully with much expedient march</div>
                     <div class="line">Have brought a countercheque before your gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">To save unscratch'd your city's threatened cheeks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold, the French amazed vouchsafe a parle;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now, instead of bullets wrapp'd in fire,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a shaking fever in your walls,</div>
                     <div class="line">They shoot but calm words folded up in smoke,</div>
                     <div class="line">To make a faithless error in your ears:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which trust accordingly, kind citizens,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let us in, your king, whose labour'd spirits,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forwearied in this action of swift speed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crave harbourage within your city walls.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">When I have said, make answer to us both.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, in this right hand, whose protection</div>
                     <div class="line">Is most divinely vow'd upon the right</div>
                     <div class="line">Of him it holds, stands young Plantagenet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Son to the elder brother of this man,</div>
                     <div class="line">And king o'er him and all that he enjoys:</div>
                     <div class="line">For this down-trodden equity, we tread</div>
                     <div class="line">In warlike march these greens before your town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being no further enemy to you</div>
                     <div class="line">Than the constraint of hospitable zeal</div>
                     <div class="line">In the relief of this oppressed child</div>
                     <div class="line">Religiously provokes. Be pleased then</div>
                     <div class="line">To pay that duty which you truly owe</div>
                     <div class="line">To that owes it, namely this young prince:</div>
                     <div class="line">And then our arms, like to a muzzled bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Save in aspect, hath all offence seal'd up;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our cannons' malice vainly shall be spent</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the invulnerable clouds of heaven;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with a blessed and unvex'd retire,</div>
                     <div class="line">With unhack'd swords and helmets all unbruised,</div>
                     <div class="line">We will bear home that lusty blood again</div>
                     <div class="line">Which here we came to spout against your town,</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave your children, wives and you in peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">But if you fondly pass our proffer'd offer,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis not the roundure of your old-faced walls</div>
                     <div class="line">Can hide you from our messengers of war,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though all these English and their discipline</div>
                     <div class="line">Were harbour'd in their rude circumference.</div>
                     <div class="line">Then tell us, shall your city call us lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">In that behalf which we have challenged it?</div>
                     <div class="line">Or shall we give the signal to our rage</div>
                     <div class="line">And stalk in blood to our possession?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">In brief, we are the king of England's subjects:</div>
                     <div class="line">For him, and in his right, we hold this town.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Acknowledge then the king, and let me in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">That can we not; but he that proves the king,</div>
                     <div class="line">To him will we prove loyal: till that time</div>
                     <div class="line">Have we ramm'd up our gates against the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth not the crown of England prove the king?</div>
                     <div class="line">And if not that, I bring you witnesses,</div>
                     <div class="line">Twice fifteen thousand hearts of England's breed,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Bastards, and else.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">To verify our title with their lives.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">As many and as well-born bloods as those,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Some bastards too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Stand in his face to contradict his claim.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Till you compound whose right is worthiest,</div>
                     <div class="line">We for the worthiest hold the right from both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Then God forgive the sin of all those souls</div>
                     <div class="line">That to their everlasting residence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the dew of evening fall, shall fleet,</div>
                     <div class="line">In dreadful trial of our kingdom's king!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Amen, amen! Mount, chevaliers! to arms!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Saint George, that swinged the dragon, and e'er since</div>
                     <div class="line">Sits on his horseback at mine hostess' door,</div>
                     <div class="line">Teach us some fence!</div>
                     <p>To AUSTRIA</p>
                     <div class="line">Sirrah, were I at home,</div>
                     <div class="line">At your den, sirrah, with your lioness</div>
                     <div class="line">I would set an ox-head to your lion's hide,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a monster of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
