                     <div class="line">Peace! no more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">O tremble, for you hear the lion roar.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Up higher to the plain; where we'll set forth</div>
                     <div class="line">In best appointment all our regiments.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Speed then, to take advantage of the field.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall be so; and at the other hill</div>
                     <div class="line">Command the rest to stand. God and our right!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
               <p>Here after excursions, enter the Herald of France,
with trumpets, to the gates</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">French Herald</div>
                     <div class="line">You men of Angiers, open wide your gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let young Arthur, Duke of Bretagne, in,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who by the hand of France this day hath made</div>
                     <div class="line">Much work for tears in many an English mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose sons lie scattered on the bleeding ground;</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a widow's husband grovelling lies,</div>
                     <div class="line">Coldly embracing the discolour'd earth;</div>
                     <div class="line">And victory, with little loss, doth play</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the dancing banners of the French,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who are at hand, triumphantly display'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To enter conquerors and to proclaim</div>
                     <div class="line">Arthur of Bretagne England's king and yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter English Herald, with trumpet</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">English Herald</div>
                     <div class="line">Rejoice, you men of Angiers, ring your bells:</div>
                     <div class="line">King John, your king and England's doth approach,</div>
                     <div class="line">Commander of this hot malicious day:</div>
                     <div class="line">Their armours, that march'd hence so silver-bright,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hither return all gilt with Frenchmen's blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">There stuck no plume in any English crest</div>
                     <div class="line">That is removed by a staff of France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Our colours do return in those same hands</div>
                     <div class="line">That did display them when we first march'd forth;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a troop of jolly huntsmen, come</div>
                     <div class="line">Our lusty English, all with purpled hands,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dyed in the dying slaughter of their foes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Open your gates and gives the victors way.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Heralds, from off our towers we might behold,</div>
                     <div class="line">From first to last, the onset and retire</div>
                     <div class="line">Of both your armies; whose equality</div>
                     <div class="line">By our best eyes cannot be censured:</div>
                     <div class="line">Blood hath bought blood and blows have answered blows;</div>
                     <div class="line">Strength match'd with strength, and power confronted power:</div>
                     <div class="line">Both are alike; and both alike we like.</div>
                     <div class="line">One must prove greatest: while they weigh so even,</div>
                     <div class="line">We hold our town for neither, yet for both.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter KING JOHN and KING PHILIP, with their
powers, severally</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">France, hast thou yet more blood to cast away?</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, shall the current of our right run on?</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose passage, vex'd with thy impediment,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall leave his native channel and o'erswell</div>
                     <div class="line">With course disturb'd even thy confining shores,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless thou let his silver water keep</div>
                     <div class="line">A peaceful progress to the ocean.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">England, thou hast not saved one drop of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">In this hot trial, more than we of France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rather, lost more. And by this hand I swear,</div>
                     <div class="line">That sways the earth this climate overlooks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before we will lay down our just-borne arms,</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll put thee down, 'gainst whom these arms we bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or add a royal number to the dead,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gracing the scroll that tells of this war's loss</div>
                     <div class="line">With slaughter coupled to the name of kings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Ha, majesty! how high thy glory towers,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the rich blood of kings is set on fire!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, now doth Death line his dead chaps with steel;</div>
                     <div class="line">The swords of soldiers are his teeth, his fangs;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now he feasts, mousing the flesh of men,</div>
                     <div class="line">In undetermined differences of kings.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why stand these royal fronts amazed thus?</div>
                     <div class="line">Cry, 'havoc!' kings; back to the stained field,</div>
                     <div class="line">You equal potents, fiery kindled spirits!</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let confusion of one part confirm</div>
                     <div class="line">The other's peace: till then, blows, blood and death!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose party do the townsmen yet admit?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, citizens, for England; who's your king?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">The king of England; when we know the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Know him in us, that here hold up his right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">In us, that are our own great deputy</div>
                     <div class="line">And bear possession of our person here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord of our presence, Angiers, and of you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">A greater power then we denies all this;</div>
                     <div class="line">And till it be undoubted, we do lock</div>
                     <div class="line">Our former scruple in our strong-barr'd gates;</div>
                     <div class="line">King'd of our fears, until our fears, resolved,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be by some certain king purged and deposed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, these scroyles of Angiers flout you, kings,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stand securely on their battlements,</div>
                     <div class="line">As in a theatre, whence they gape and point</div>
                     <div class="line">At your industrious scenes and acts of death.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your royal presences be ruled by me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do like the mutines of Jerusalem,</div>
                     <div class="line">Be friends awhile and both conjointly bend</div>
                     <div class="line">Your sharpest deeds of malice on this town:</div>
                     <div class="line">By east and west let France and England mount</div>
                     <div class="line">Their battering cannon charged to the mouths,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till their soul-fearing clamours have brawl'd down</div>
                     <div class="line">The flinty ribs of this contemptuous city:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'ld play incessantly upon these jades,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even till unfenced desolation</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave them as naked as the vulgar air.</div>
                     <div class="line">That done, dissever your united strengths,</div>
                     <div class="line">And part your mingled colours once again;</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn face to face and bloody point to point;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, in a moment, Fortune shall cull forth</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of one side her happy minion,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom in favour she shall give the day,</div>
                     <div class="line">And kiss him with a glorious victory.</div>
                     <div class="line">How like you this wild counsel, mighty states?</div>
                     <div class="line">Smacks it not something of the policy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by the sky that hangs above our heads,</div>
                     <div class="line">I like it well. France, shall we knit our powers</div>
                     <div class="line">And lay this Angiers even to the ground;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then after fight who shall be king of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">An if thou hast the mettle of a king,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being wronged as we are by this peevish town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn thou the mouth of thy artillery,</div>
                     <div class="line">As we will ours, against these saucy walls;</div>
                     <div class="line">And when that we have dash'd them to the ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then defy each other and pell-mell</div>
                     <div class="line">Make work upon ourselves, for heaven or hell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be so. Say, where will you assault?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">We from the west will send destruction</div>
                     <div class="line">Into this city's bosom.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I from the north.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Our thunder from the south</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall rain their drift of bullets on this town.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">O prudent discipline! From north to south:</div>
                     <div class="line">Austria and France shoot in each other's mouth:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll stir them to it. Come, away, away!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear us, great kings: vouchsafe awhile to stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I shall show you peace and fair-faced league;</div>
                     <div class="line">Win you this city without stroke or wound;</div>
                     <div class="line">Rescue those breathing lives to die in beds,</div>
                     <div class="line">That here come sacrifices for the field:</div>
                     <div class="line">Persever not, but hear me, mighty kings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak on with favour; we are bent to hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">That daughter there of Spain, the Lady Blanch,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is niece to England: look upon the years</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Lewis the Dauphin and that lovely maid:</div>
                     <div class="line">If lusty love should go in quest of beauty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where should he find it fairer than in Blanch?</div>
                     <div class="line">If zealous love should go in search of virtue,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where should he find it purer than in Blanch?</div>
                     <div class="line">If love ambitious sought a match of birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose veins bound richer blood than Lady Blanch?</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as she is, in beauty, virtue, birth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is the young Dauphin every way complete:</div>
                     <div class="line">If not complete of, say he is not she;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she again wants nothing, to name want,</div>
                     <div class="line">If want it be not that she is not he:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is the half part of a blessed man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Left to be finished by such as she;</div>
                     <div class="line">And she a fair divided excellence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose fulness of perfection lies in him.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, two such silver currents, when they join,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do glorify the banks that bound them in;</div>
                     <div class="line">And two such shores to two such streams made one,</div>
                     <div class="line">Two such controlling bounds shall you be, kings,</div>
                     <div class="line">To these two princes, if you marry them.</div>
                     <div class="line">This union shall do more than battery can</div>
                     <div class="line">To our fast-closed gates; for at this match,</div>
                     <div class="line">With swifter spleen than powder can enforce,</div>
                     <div class="line">The mouth of passage shall we fling wide ope,</div>
                     <div class="line">And give you entrance: but without this match,</div>
                     <div class="line">The sea enraged is not half so deaf,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lions more confident, mountains and rocks</div>
                     <div class="line">More free from motion, no, not Death himself</div>
                     <div class="line">In moral fury half so peremptory,</div>
                     <div class="line">As we to keep this city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's a stay</div>
                     <div class="line">That shakes the rotten carcass of old Death</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of his rags! Here's a large mouth, indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">That spits forth death and mountains, rocks and seas,</div>
                     <div class="line">Talks as familiarly of roaring lions</div>
                     <div class="line">As maids of thirteen do of puppy-dogs!</div>
                     <div class="line">What cannoneer begot this lusty blood?</div>
                     <div class="line">He speaks plain cannon fire, and smoke and bounce;</div>
                     <div class="line">He gives the bastinado with his tongue:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our ears are cudgell'd; not a word of his</div>
                     <div class="line">But buffets better than a fist of France:</div>
                     <div class="line">Zounds! I was never so bethump'd with words</div>
                     <div class="line">Since I first call'd my brother's father dad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Son, list to this conjunction, make this match;</div>
                     <div class="line">Give with our niece a dowry large enough:</div>
                     <div class="line">For by this knot thou shalt so surely tie</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy now unsured assurance to the crown,</div>
                     <div class="line">That yon green boy shall have no sun to ripe</div>
                     <div class="line">The bloom that promiseth a mighty fruit.</div>
                     <div class="line">I see a yielding in the looks of France;</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark, how they whisper: urge them while their souls</div>
                     <div class="line">Are capable of this ambition,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest zeal, now melted by the windy breath</div>
                     <div class="line">Of soft petitions, pity and remorse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cool and congeal again to what it was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                     <div class="line">Why answer not the double majesties</div>
                     <div class="line">This friendly treaty of our threaten'd town?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak England first, that hath been forward first</div>
                     <div class="line">To speak unto this city: what say you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">If that the Dauphin there, thy princely son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Can in this book of beauty read 'I love,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Her dowry shall weigh equal with a queen:</div>
                     <div class="line">For Anjou and fair Touraine, Maine, Poictiers,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all that we upon this side the sea,</div>
                     <div class="line">Except this city now by us besieged,</div>
                     <div class="line">Find liable to our crown and dignity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall gild her bridal bed and make her rich</div>
                     <div class="line">In titles, honours and promotions,</div>
                     <div class="line">As she in beauty, education, blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">Holds hand with any princess of the world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">What say'st thou, boy? look in the lady's face.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">I do, my lord; and in her eye I find</div>
                     <div class="line">A wonder, or a wondrous miracle,</div>
                     <div class="line">The shadow of myself form'd in her eye:</div>
                     <div class="line">Which being but the shadow of your son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Becomes a sun and makes your son a shadow:</div>
                     <div class="line">I do protest I never loved myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Till now infixed I beheld myself</div>
                     <div class="line">Drawn in the flattering table of her eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Whispers with BLANCH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Drawn in the flattering table of her eye!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang'd in the frowning wrinkle of her brow!</div>
                     <div class="line">And quarter'd in her heart! he doth espy</div>
                     <div class="line">Himself love's traitor: this is pity now,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hang'd and drawn and quartered, there should be</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a love so vile a lout as he.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">My uncle's will in this respect is mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">If he see aught in you that makes him like,</div>
                     <div class="line">That any thing he sees, which moves his liking,</div>
                     <div class="line">I can with ease translate it to my will;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if you will, to speak more properly,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will enforce it easily to my love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Further I will not flatter you, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">That all I see in you is worthy love,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than this; that nothing do I see in you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though churlish thoughts themselves should be your judge,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I can find should merit any hate.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What say these young ones? What say you my niece?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">That she is bound in honour still to do</div>
                     <div class="line">What you in wisdom still vouchsafe to say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak then, prince Dauphin; can you love this lady?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, ask me if I can refrain from love;</div>
                     <div class="line">For I do love her most unfeignedly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Then do I give Volquessen, Touraine, Maine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Poictiers and Anjou, these five provinces,</div>
                     <div class="line">With her to thee; and this addition more,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full thirty thousand marks of English coin.</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip of France, if thou be pleased withal,</div>
                     <div class="line">Command thy son and daughter to join hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">It likes us well; young princes, close your hands.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">And your lips too; for I am well assured</div>
                     <div class="line">That I did so when I was first assured.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, citizens of Angiers, ope your gates,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let in that amity which you have made;</div>
                     <div class="line">For at Saint Mary's chapel presently</div>
                     <div class="line">The rites of marriage shall be solemnized.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not the Lady Constance in this troop?</div>
                     <div class="line">I know she is not, for this match made up</div>
                     <div class="line">Her presence would have interrupted much:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is she and her son? tell me, who knows.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">She is sad and passionate at your highness' tent.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by my faith, this league that we have made</div>
                     <div class="line">Will give her sadness very little cure.</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother of England, how may we content</div>
                     <div class="line">This widow lady? In her right we came;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which we, God knows, have turn'd another way,</div>
                     <div class="line">To our own vantage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">We will heal up all;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we'll create young Arthur Duke of Bretagne</div>
                     <div class="line">And Earl of Richmond; and this rich fair town</div>
                     <div class="line">We make him lord of. Call the Lady Constance;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some speedy messenger bid her repair</div>
                     <div class="line">To our solemnity: I trust we shall,</div>
                     <div class="line">If not fill up the measure of her will,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet in some measure satisfy her so</div>
                     <div class="line">That we shall stop her exclamation.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go we, as well as haste will suffer us,</div>
                     <div class="line">To this unlook'd for, unprepared pomp.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but the BASTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Mad world! mad kings! mad composition!</div>
                     <div class="line">John, to stop Arthur's title in the whole,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath willingly departed with a part,</div>
                     <div class="line">And France, whose armour conscience buckled on,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom zeal and charity brought to the field</div>
                     <div class="line">As God's own soldier, rounded in the ear</div>
                     <div class="line">With that same purpose-changer, that sly devil,</div>
                     <div class="line">That broker, that still breaks the pate of faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">That daily break-vow, he that wins of all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of kings, of beggars, old men, young men, maids,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, having no external thing to lose</div>
                     <div class="line">But the word 'maid,' cheats the poor maid of that,</div>
                     <div class="line">That smooth-faced gentleman, tickling Commodity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Commodity, the bias of the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">The world, who of itself is peised well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made to run even upon even ground,</div>
                     <div class="line">Till this advantage, this vile-drawing bias,</div>
                     <div class="line">This sway of motion, this Commodity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes it take head from all indifferency,</div>
                     <div class="line">From all direction, purpose, course, intent:</div>
                     <div class="line">And this same bias, this Commodity,</div>
                     <div class="line">This bawd, this broker, this all-changing word,</div>
                     <div class="line">Clapp'd on the outward eye of fickle France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath drawn him from his own determined aid,</div>
                     <div class="line">From a resolved and honourable war,</div>
                     <div class="line">To a most base and vile-concluded peace.</div>
                     <div class="line">And why rail I on this Commodity?</div>
                     <div class="line">But for because he hath not woo'd me yet:</div>
                     <div class="line">Not that I have the power to clutch my hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">When his fair angels would salute my palm;</div>
                     <div class="line">But for my hand, as unattempted yet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a poor beggar, raileth on the rich.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, whiles I am a beggar, I will rail</div>
                     <div class="line">And say there is no sin but to be rich;</div>
                     <div class="line">And being rich, my virtue then shall be</div>
                     <div class="line">To say there is no vice but beggary.</div>
                     <div class="line">Since kings break faith upon commodity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gain, be my lord, for I will worship thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.5">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 3. ACT III</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.2">1. SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.3">2. SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.4">3. SCENE III.  The same.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.5.5">4. SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The French King's pavilion.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CONSTANCE, ARTHUR, and SALISBURY</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Gone to be married! gone to swear a peace!</div>
                     <div class="line">False blood to false blood join'd! gone to be friends!</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall Lewis have Blanch, and Blanch those provinces?</div>
                     <div class="line">It is not so; thou hast misspoke, misheard:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be well advised, tell o'er thy tale again:</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be; thou dost but say 'tis so:</div>
                     <div class="line">I trust I may not trust thee; for thy word</div>
                     <div class="line">Is but the vain breath of a common man:</div>
                     <div class="line">Believe me, I do not believe thee, man;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a king's oath to the contrary.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt be punish'd for thus frighting me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am sick and capable of fears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Oppress'd with wrongs and therefore full of fears,</div>
                     <div class="line">A widow, husbandless, subject to fears,</div>
                     <div class="line">A woman, naturally born to fears;</div>
                     <div class="line">And though thou now confess thou didst but jest,</div>
                     <div class="line">With my vex'd spirits I cannot take a truce,</div>
                     <div class="line">But they will quake and tremble all this day.</div>
                     <div class="line">What dost thou mean by shaking of thy head?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why dost thou look so sadly on my son?</div>
                     <div class="line">What means that hand upon that breast of thine?</div>
                     <div class="line">Why holds thine eye that lamentable rheum,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like a proud river peering o'er his bounds?</div>
                     <div class="line">Be these sad signs confirmers of thy words?</div>
                     <div class="line">Then speak again; not all thy former tale,</div>
                     <div class="line">But this one word, whether thy tale be true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">As true as I believe you think them false</div>
                     <div class="line">That give you cause to prove my saying true.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if thou teach me to believe this sorrow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Teach thou this sorrow how to make me die,</div>
                     <div class="line">And let belief and life encounter so</div>
                     <div class="line">As doth the fury of two desperate men</div>
                     <div class="line">Which in the very meeting fall and die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lewis marry Blanch! O boy, then where art thou?</div>
                     <div class="line">France friend with England, what becomes of me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Fellow, be gone: I cannot brook thy sight:</div>
                     <div class="line">This news hath made thee a most ugly man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">What other harm have I, good lady, done,</div>
                     <div class="line">But spoke the harm that is by others done?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Which harm within itself so heinous is</div>
                     <div class="line">As it makes harmful all that speak of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">I do beseech you, madam, be content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou, that bid'st me be content, wert grim,</div>
                     <div class="line">Ugly and slanderous to thy mother's womb,</div>
                     <div class="line">Full of unpleasing blots and sightless stains,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lame, foolish, crooked, swart, prodigious,</div>
                     <div class="line">Patch'd with foul moles and eye-offending marks,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not care, I then would be content,</div>
                     <div class="line">For then I should not love thee, no, nor thou</div>
                     <div class="line">Become thy great birth nor deserve a crown.</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou art fair, and at thy birth, dear boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nature and Fortune join'd to make thee great:</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Nature's gifts thou mayst with lilies boast,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with the half-blown rose. But Fortune, O,</div>
                     <div class="line">She is corrupted, changed and won from thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">She adulterates hourly with thine uncle John,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with her golden hand hath pluck'd on France</div>
                     <div class="line">To tread down fair respect of sovereignty,</div>
                     <div class="line">And made his majesty the bawd to theirs.</div>
                     <div class="line">France is a bawd to Fortune and King John,</div>
                     <div class="line">That strumpet Fortune, that usurping John!</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, thou fellow, is not France forsworn?</div>
                     <div class="line">Envenom him with words, or get thee gone</div>
                     <div class="line">And leave those woes alone which I alone</div>
                     <div class="line">Am bound to under-bear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon me, madam,</div>
                     <div class="line">I may not go without you to the kings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou mayst, thou shalt; I will not go with thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">I will instruct my sorrows to be proud;</div>
                     <div class="line">For grief is proud and makes his owner stoop.</div>
                     <div class="line">To me and to the state of my great grief</div>
                     <div class="line">Let kings assemble; for my grief's so great</div>
                     <div class="line">That no supporter but the huge firm earth</div>
                     <div class="line">Can hold it up: here I and sorrows sit;</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is my throne, bid kings come bow to it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Seats herself on the ground</p>
               <p>Enter KING JOHN, KING PHILLIP, LEWIS, BLANCH,
QUEEN ELINOR, the BASTARD, AUSTRIA, and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true, fair daughter; and this blessed day</div>
                     <div class="line">Ever in France shall be kept festival:</div>
                     <div class="line">To solemnize this day the glorious sun</div>
                     <div class="line">Stays in his course and plays the alchemist,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning with splendor of his precious eye</div>
                     <div class="line">The meagre cloddy earth to glittering gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">The yearly course that brings this day about</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall never see it but a holiday.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">A wicked day, and not a holy day!</div>
                     <p>Rising</p>
                     <div class="line">What hath this day deserved? what hath it done,</div>
                     <div class="line">That it in golden letters should be set</div>
                     <div class="line">Among the high tides in the calendar?</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, rather turn this day out of the week,</div>
                     <div class="line">This day of shame, oppression, perjury.</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, if it must stand still, let wives with child</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray that their burthens may not fall this day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest that their hopes prodigiously be cross'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">But on this day let seamen fear no wreck;</div>
                     <div class="line">No bargains break that are not this day made:</div>
                     <div class="line">This day, all things begun come to ill end,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, faith itself to hollow falsehood change!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, lady, you shall have no cause</div>
                     <div class="line">To curse the fair proceedings of this day:</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I not pawn'd to you my majesty?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">You have beguiled me with a counterfeit</div>
                     <div class="line">Resembling majesty, which, being touch'd and tried,</div>
                     <div class="line">Proves valueless: you are forsworn, forsworn;</div>
                     <div class="line">You came in arms to spill mine enemies' blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">But now in arms you strengthen it with yours:</div>
                     <div class="line">The grappling vigour and rough frown of war</div>
                     <div class="line">Is cold in amity and painted peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">And our oppression hath made up this league.</div>
                     <div class="line">Arm, arm, you heavens, against these perjured kings!</div>
                     <div class="line">A widow cries; be husband to me, heavens!</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not the hours of this ungodly day</div>
                     <div class="line">Wear out the day in peace; but, ere sunset,</div>
                     <div class="line">Set armed discord 'twixt these perjured kings!</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me, O, hear me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady Constance, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">War! war! no peace! peace is to me a war</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lymoges! O Austria! thou dost shame</div>
                     <div class="line">That bloody spoil: thou slave, thou wretch, thou coward!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou little valiant, great in villany!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou ever strong upon the stronger side!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou Fortune's champion that dost never fight</div>
                     <div class="line">But when her humorous ladyship is by</div>
                     <div class="line">To teach thee safety! thou art perjured too,</div>
                     <div class="line">And soothest up greatness. What a fool art thou,</div>
                     <div class="line">A ramping fool, to brag and stamp and swear</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my party! Thou cold-blooded slave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou not spoke like thunder on my side,</div>
                     <div class="line">Been sworn my soldier, bidding me depend</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thy stars, thy fortune and thy strength,</div>
                     <div class="line">And dost thou now fall over to my fores?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou wear a lion's hide! doff it for shame,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that a man should speak those words to me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou darest not say so, villain, for thy life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">We like not this; thou dost forget thyself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter CARDINAL PANDULPH</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the holy legate of the pope.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Hail, you anointed deputies of heaven!</div>
                     <div class="line">To thee, King John, my holy errand is.</div>
                     <div class="line">I Pandulph, of fair Milan cardinal,</div>
                     <div class="line">And from Pope Innocent the legate here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do in his name religiously demand</div>
                     <div class="line">Why thou against the church, our holy mother,</div>
                     <div class="line">So wilfully dost spurn; and force perforce</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep Stephen Langton, chosen archbishop</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Canterbury, from that holy see?</div>
                     <div class="line">This, in our foresaid holy father's name,</div>
                     <div class="line">Pope Innocent, I do demand of thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">What earthy name to interrogatories</div>
                     <div class="line">Can task the free breath of a sacred king?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou canst not, cardinal, devise a name</div>
                     <div class="line">So slight, unworthy and ridiculous,</div>
                     <div class="line">To charge me to an answer, as the pope.</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him this tale; and from the mouth of England</div>
                     <div class="line">Add thus much more, that no Italian priest</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall tithe or toll in our dominions;</div>
                     <div class="line">But as we, under heaven, are supreme head,</div>
                     <div class="line">So under Him that great supremacy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where we do reign, we will alone uphold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the assistance of a mortal hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">So tell the pope, all reverence set apart</div>
                     <div class="line">To him and his usurp'd authority.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Brother of England, you blaspheme in this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Though you and all the kings of Christendom</div>
                     <div class="line">Are led so grossly by this meddling priest,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dreading the curse that money may buy out;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the merit of vile gold, dross, dust,</div>
                     <div class="line">Purchase corrupted pardon of a man,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who in that sale sells pardon from himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though you and all the rest so grossly led</div>
                     <div class="line">This juggling witchcraft with revenue cherish,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I alone, alone do me oppose</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the pope and count his friends my foes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, by the lawful power that I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt stand cursed and excommunicate.</div>
                     <div class="line">And blessed shall he be that doth revolt</div>
                     <div class="line">From his allegiance to an heretic;</div>
                     <div class="line">And meritorious shall that hand be call'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Canonized and worshipped as a saint,</div>
                     <div class="line">That takes away by any secret course</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy hateful life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, lawful let it be</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have room with Rome to curse awhile!</div>
                     <div class="line">Good father cardinal, cry thou amen</div>
                     <div class="line">To my keen curses; for without my wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no tongue hath power to curse him right.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">There's law and warrant, lady, for my curse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">And for mine too: when law can do no right,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be lawful that law bar no wrong:</div>
                     <div class="line">Law cannot give my child his kingdom here,</div>
                     <div class="line">For he that holds his kingdom holds the law;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, since law itself is perfect wrong,</div>
                     <div class="line">How can the law forbid my tongue to curse?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip of France, on peril of a curse,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let go the hand of that arch-heretic;</div>
                     <div class="line">And raise the power of France upon his head,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless he do submit himself to Rome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Look'st thou pale, France? do not let go thy hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to that, devil; lest that France repent,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by disjoining hands, hell lose a soul.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">King Philip, listen to the cardinal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">And hang a calf's-skin on his recreant limbs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, ruffian, I must pocket up these wrongs, Because--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Your breeches best may carry them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Philip, what say'st thou to the cardinal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">What should he say, but as the cardinal?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Bethink you, father; for the difference</div>
                     <div class="line">Is purchase of a heavy curse from Rome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or the light loss of England for a friend:</div>
                     <div class="line">Forego the easier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">That's the curse of Rome.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lewis, stand fast! the devil tempts thee here</div>
                     <div class="line">In likeness of a new untrimmed bride.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lady Constance speaks not from her faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">But from her need.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if thou grant my need,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which only lives but by the death of faith,</div>
                     <div class="line">That need must needs infer this principle,</div>
                     <div class="line">That faith would live again by death of need.</div>
                     <div class="line">O then, tread down my need, and faith mounts up;</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep my need up, and faith is trodden down!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">The king is moved, and answers not to this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, be removed from him, and answer well!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Do so, King Philip; hang no more in doubt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Hang nothing but a calf's-skin, most sweet lout.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">I am perplex'd, and know not what to say.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">What canst thou say but will perplex thee more,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou stand excommunicate and cursed?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Good reverend father, make my person yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell me how you would bestow yourself.</div>
                     <div class="line">This royal hand and mine are newly knit,</div>
                     <div class="line">And the conjunction of our inward souls</div>
                     <div class="line">Married in league, coupled and linked together</div>
                     <div class="line">With all religious strength of sacred vows;</div>
                     <div class="line">The latest breath that gave the sound of words</div>
                     <div class="line">Was deep-sworn faith, peace, amity, true love</div>
                     <div class="line">Between our kingdoms and our royal selves,</div>
                     <div class="line">And even before this truce, but new before,</div>
                     <div class="line">No longer than we well could wash our hands</div>
                     <div class="line">To clap this royal bargain up of peace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven knows, they were besmear'd and over-stain'd</div>
                     <div class="line">With slaughter's pencil, where revenge did paint</div>
                     <div class="line">The fearful difference of incensed kings:</div>
                     <div class="line">And shall these hands, so lately purged of blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">So newly join'd in love, so strong in both,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unyoke this seizure and this kind regreet?</div>
                     <div class="line">Play fast and loose with faith? so jest with heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Make such unconstant children of ourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">As now again to snatch our palm from palm,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unswear faith sworn, and on the marriage-bed</div>
                     <div class="line">Of smiling peace to march a bloody host,</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a riot on the gentle brow</div>
                     <div class="line">Of true sincerity? O, holy sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">My reverend father, let it not be so!</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of your grace, devise, ordain, impose</div>
                     <div class="line">Some gentle order; and then we shall be blest</div>
                     <div class="line">To do your pleasure and continue friends.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">All form is formless, order orderless,</div>
                     <div class="line">Save what is opposite to England's love.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore to arms! be champion of our church,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or let the church, our mother, breathe her curse,</div>
                     <div class="line">A mother's curse, on her revolting son.</div>
                     <div class="line">France, thou mayst hold a serpent by the tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">A chafed lion by the mortal paw,</div>
                     <div class="line">A fasting tiger safer by the tooth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Than keep in peace that hand which thou dost hold.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">I may disjoin my hand, but not my faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">So makest thou faith an enemy to faith;</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a civil war set'st oath to oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy tongue against thy tongue. O, let thy vow</div>
                     <div class="line">First made to heaven, first be to heaven perform'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">That is, to be the champion of our church!</div>
                     <div class="line">What since thou sworest is sworn against thyself</div>
                     <div class="line">And may not be performed by thyself,</div>
                     <div class="line">For that which thou hast sworn to do amiss</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not amiss when it is truly done,</div>
                     <div class="line">And being not done, where doing tends to ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">The truth is then most done not doing it:</div>
                     <div class="line">The better act of purposes mistook</div>
                     <div class="line">Is to mistake again; though indirect,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet indirection thereby grows direct,</div>
                     <div class="line">And falsehood falsehood cures, as fire cools fire</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the scorched veins of one new-burn'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">It is religion that doth make vows kept;</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou hast sworn against religion,</div>
                     <div class="line">By what thou swear'st against the thing thou swear'st,</div>
                     <div class="line">And makest an oath the surety for thy truth</div>
                     <div class="line">Against an oath: the truth thou art unsure</div>
                     <div class="line">To swear, swears only not to be forsworn;</div>
                     <div class="line">Else what a mockery should it be to swear!</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou dost swear only to be forsworn;</div>
                     <div class="line">And most forsworn, to keep what thou dost swear.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore thy later vows against thy first</div>
                     <div class="line">Is in thyself rebellion to thyself;</div>
                     <div class="line">And better conquest never canst thou make</div>
                     <div class="line">Than arm thy constant and thy nobler parts</div>
                     <div class="line">Against these giddy loose suggestions:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon which better part our prayers come in,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou vouchsafe them. But if not, then know</div>
                     <div class="line">The peril of our curses light on thee</div>
                     <div class="line">So heavy as thou shalt not shake them off,</div>
                     <div class="line">But in despair die under their black weight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Rebellion, flat rebellion!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Will't not be?</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not a calfs-skin stop that mouth of thine?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, to arms!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon thy wedding-day?</div>
                     <div class="line">Against the blood that thou hast married?</div>
                     <div class="line">What, shall our feast be kept with slaughter'd men?</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall braying trumpets and loud churlish drums,</div>
                     <div class="line">Clamours of hell, be measures to our pomp?</div>
                     <div class="line">O husband, hear me! ay, alack, how new</div>
                     <div class="line">Is husband in my mouth! even for that name,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which till this time my tongue did ne'er pronounce,</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my knee I beg, go not to arms</div>
                     <div class="line">Against mine uncle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, upon my knee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made hard with kneeling, I do pray to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou virtuous Dauphin, alter not the doom</div>
                     <div class="line">Forethought by heaven!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">Now shall I see thy love: what motive may</div>
                     <div class="line">Be stronger with thee than the name of wife?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">That which upholdeth him that thee upholds,</div>
                     <div class="line">His honour: O, thine honour, Lewis, thine honour!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">I muse your majesty doth seem so cold,</div>
                     <div class="line">When such profound respects do pull you on.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">I will denounce a curse upon his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shalt not need. England, I will fall from thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">O fair return of banish'd majesty!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">O foul revolt of French inconstancy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">France, thou shalt rue this hour within this hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Old Time the clock-setter, that bald sexton Time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it as he will? well then, France shall rue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun's o'ercast with blood: fair day, adieu!</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the side that I must go withal?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am with both: each army hath a hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in their rage, I having hold of both,</div>
                     <div class="line">They swirl asunder and dismember me.</div>
