                     <div class="line">Husband, I cannot pray that thou mayst win;</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncle, I needs must pray that thou mayst lose;</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, I may not wish the fortune thine;</div>
                     <div class="line">Grandam, I will not wish thy fortunes thrive:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whoever wins, on that side shall I lose</div>
                     <div class="line">Assured loss before the match be play'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, with me, with me thy fortune lies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                     <div class="line">There where my fortune lives, there my life dies.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, go draw our puissance together.</div>
                     <p>Exit BASTARD</p>
                     <div class="line">France, I am burn'd up with inflaming wrath;</div>
                     <div class="line">A rage whose heat hath this condition,</div>
                     <div class="line">That nothing can allay, nothing but blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">The blood, and dearest-valued blood, of France.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy rage sham burn thee up, and thou shalt turn</div>
                     <div class="line">To ashes, ere our blood shall quench that fire:</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to thyself, thou art in jeopardy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">No more than he that threats. To arms let's hie!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. Plains near Angiers.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums, excursions. Enter the BASTARD, with
AUSTRIA'S head</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by my life, this day grows wondrous hot;</div>
                     <div class="line">Some airy devil hovers in the sky</div>
                     <div class="line">And pours down mischief. Austria's head lie there,</div>
                     <div class="line">While Philip breathes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING JOHN, ARTHUR, and HUBERT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Hubert, keep this boy. Philip, make up:</div>
                     <div class="line">My mother is assailed in our tent,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ta'en, I fear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, I rescued her;</div>
                     <div class="line">Her highness is in safety, fear you not:</div>
                     <div class="line">But on, my liege; for very little pains</div>
                     <div class="line">Will bring this labour to an happy end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Alarums, excursions, retreat. Enter KING JOHN,
QUEEN ELINOR, ARTHUR, the BASTARD, HUBERT,
and Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To QUEEN ELINOR</span>  So shall it be; your grace shall</div>
                     <div class="line">stay behind</div>
                     <div class="line">So strongly guarded.</div>
                     <p>To ARTHUR</p>
                     <div class="line">Cousin, look not sad:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy grandam loves thee; and thy uncle will</div>
                     <div class="line">As dear be to thee as thy father was.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, this will make my mother die with grief!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To the BASTARD</span>  Cousin, away for England!</div>
                     <div class="line">haste before:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, ere our coming, see thou shake the bags</div>
                     <div class="line">Of hoarding abbots; imprisoned angels</div>
                     <div class="line">Set at liberty: the fat ribs of peace</div>
                     <div class="line">Must by the hungry now be fed upon:</div>
                     <div class="line">Use our commission in his utmost force.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">Bell, book, and candle shall not drive me back,</div>
                     <div class="line">When gold and silver becks me to come on.</div>
                     <div class="line">I leave your highness. Grandam, I will pray,</div>
                     <div class="line">If ever I remember to be holy,</div>
                     <div class="line">For your fair safety; so, I kiss your hand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, gentle cousin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Coz, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit the BASTARD</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, little kinsman; hark, a word.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Come hither, Hubert. O my gentle Hubert,</div>
                     <div class="line">We owe thee much! within this wall of flesh</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a soul counts thee her creditor</div>
                     <div class="line">And with advantage means to pay thy love:</div>
                     <div class="line">And my good friend, thy voluntary oath</div>
                     <div class="line">Lives in this bosom, dearly cherished.</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me thy hand. I had a thing to say,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will fit it with some better time.</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, Hubert, I am almost ashamed</div>
                     <div class="line">To say what good respect I have of thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">I am much bounden to your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Good friend, thou hast no cause to say so yet,</div>
                     <div class="line">But thou shalt have; and creep time ne'er so slow,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet it shall come from me to do thee good.</div>
                     <div class="line">I had a thing to say, but let it go:</div>
                     <div class="line">The sun is in the heaven, and the proud day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Attended with the pleasures of the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is all too wanton and too full of gawds</div>
                     <div class="line">To give me audience: if the midnight bell</div>
                     <div class="line">Did, with his iron tongue and brazen mouth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sound on into the drowsy race of night;</div>
                     <div class="line">If this same were a churchyard where we stand,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou possessed with a thousand wrongs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if that surly spirit, melancholy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had baked thy blood and made it heavy-thick,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which else runs tickling up and down the veins,</div>
                     <div class="line">Making that idiot, laughter, keep men's eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">And strain their cheeks to idle merriment,</div>
                     <div class="line">A passion hateful to my purposes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or if that thou couldst see me without eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hear me without thine ears, and make reply</div>
                     <div class="line">Without a tongue, using conceit alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without eyes, ears and harmful sound of words;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, in despite of brooded watchful day,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would into thy bosom pour my thoughts:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, ah, I will not! yet I love thee well;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, by my troth, I think thou lovest me well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">So well, that what you bid me undertake,</div>
                     <div class="line">Though that my death were adjunct to my act,</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, I would do it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Do not I know thou wouldst?</div>
                     <div class="line">Good Hubert, Hubert, Hubert, throw thine eye</div>
                     <div class="line">On yon young boy: I'll tell thee what, my friend,</div>
                     <div class="line">He is a very serpent in my way;</div>
                     <div class="line">And whereso'er this foot of mine doth tread,</div>
                     <div class="line">He lies before me: dost thou understand me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art his keeper.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">And I'll keep him so,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he shall not offend your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">A grave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">He shall not live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Enough.</div>
                     <div class="line">I could be merry now. Hubert, I love thee;</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I'll not say what I intend for thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">Remember. Madam, fare you well:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll send those powers o'er to your majesty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ELINOR</div>
                     <div class="line">My blessing go with thee!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">For England, cousin, go:</div>
                     <div class="line">Hubert shall be your man, attend on you</div>
                     <div class="line">With all true duty. On toward Calais, ho!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING PHILIP, LEWIS, CARDINAL PANDULPH,
and Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">So, by a roaring tempest on the flood,</div>
                     <div class="line">A whole armado of convicted sail</div>
                     <div class="line">Is scatter'd and disjoin'd from fellowship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Courage and comfort! all shall yet go well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">What can go well, when we have run so ill?</div>
                     <div class="line">Are we not beaten? Is not Angiers lost?</div>
                     <div class="line">Arthur ta'en prisoner? divers dear friends slain?</div>
                     <div class="line">And bloody England into England gone,</div>
                     <div class="line">O'erbearing interruption, spite of France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">What he hath won, that hath he fortified:</div>
                     <div class="line">So hot a speed with such advice disposed,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such temperate order in so fierce a cause,</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth want example: who hath read or heard</div>
                     <div class="line">Of any kindred action like to this?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Well could I bear that England had this praise,</div>
                     <div class="line">So we could find some pattern of our shame.</div>
                     <p>Enter CONSTANCE</p>
                     <div class="line">Look, who comes here! a grave unto a soul;</div>
                     <div class="line">Holding the eternal spirit against her will,</div>
                     <div class="line">In the vile prison of afflicted breath.</div>
                     <div class="line">I prithee, lady, go away with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, now I now see the issue of your peace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience, good lady! comfort, gentle Constance!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, I defy all counsel, all redress,</div>
                     <div class="line">But that which ends all counsel, true redress,</div>
                     <div class="line">Death, death; O amiable lovely death!</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou odouriferous stench! sound rottenness!</div>
                     <div class="line">Arise forth from the couch of lasting night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hate and terror to prosperity,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will kiss thy detestable bones</div>
                     <div class="line">And put my eyeballs in thy vaulty brows</div>
                     <div class="line">And ring these fingers with thy household worms</div>
                     <div class="line">And stop this gap of breath with fulsome dust</div>
                     <div class="line">And be a carrion monster like thyself:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, grin on me, and I will think thou smilest</div>
                     <div class="line">And buss thee as thy wife. Misery's love,</div>
                     <div class="line">O, come to me!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">O fair affliction, peace!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no, I will not, having breath to cry:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that my tongue were in the thunder's mouth!</div>
                     <div class="line">Then with a passion would I shake the world;</div>
                     <div class="line">And rouse from sleep that fell anatomy</div>
                     <div class="line">Which cannot hear a lady's feeble voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which scorns a modern invocation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Lady, you utter madness, and not sorrow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art not holy to belie me so;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not mad: this hair I tear is mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">My name is Constance; I was Geffrey's wife;</div>
                     <div class="line">Young Arthur is my son, and he is lost:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not mad: I would to heaven I were!</div>
                     <div class="line">For then, 'tis like I should forget myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if I could, what grief should I forget!</div>
                     <div class="line">Preach some philosophy to make me mad,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thou shalt be canonized, cardinal;</div>
                     <div class="line">For being not mad but sensible of grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">My reasonable part produces reason</div>
                     <div class="line">How I may be deliver'd of these woes,</div>
                     <div class="line">And teaches me to kill or hang myself:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I were mad, I should forget my son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or madly think a babe of clouts were he:</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not mad; too well, too well I feel</div>
                     <div class="line">The different plague of each calamity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Bind up those tresses. O, what love I note</div>
                     <div class="line">In the fair multitude of those her hairs!</div>
                     <div class="line">Where but by chance a silver drop hath fallen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even to that drop ten thousand wiry friends</div>
                     <div class="line">Do glue themselves in sociable grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like true, inseparable, faithful loves,</div>
                     <div class="line">Sticking together in calamity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">To England, if you will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">Bind up your hairs.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, that I will; and wherefore will I do it?</div>
                     <div class="line">I tore them from their bonds and cried aloud</div>
                     <div class="line">'O that these hands could so redeem my son,</div>
                     <div class="line">As they have given these hairs their liberty!'</div>
                     <div class="line">But now I envy at their liberty,</div>
                     <div class="line">And will again commit them to their bonds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because my poor child is a prisoner.</div>
                     <div class="line">And, father cardinal, I have heard you say</div>
                     <div class="line">That we shall see and know our friends in heaven:</div>
                     <div class="line">If that be true, I shall see my boy again;</div>
                     <div class="line">For since the birth of Cain, the first male child,</div>
                     <div class="line">To him that did but yesterday suspire,</div>
                     <div class="line">There was not such a gracious creature born.</div>
                     <div class="line">But now will canker-sorrow eat my bud</div>
                     <div class="line">And chase the native beauty from his cheek</div>
                     <div class="line">And he will look as hollow as a ghost,</div>
                     <div class="line">As dim and meagre as an ague's fit,</div>
                     <div class="line">And so he'll die; and, rising so again,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I shall meet him in the court of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall not know him: therefore never, never</div>
                     <div class="line">Must I behold my pretty Arthur more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">You hold too heinous a respect of grief.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">He talks to me that never had a son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">You are as fond of grief as of your child.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                     <div class="line">Grief fills the room up of my absent child,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lies in his bed, walks up and down with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Puts on his pretty looks, repeats his words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Remembers me of all his gracious parts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stuffs out his vacant garments with his form;</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, have I reason to be fond of grief?</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare you well: had you such a loss as I,</div>
                     <div class="line">I could give better comfort than you do.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not keep this form upon my head,</div>
                     <div class="line">When there is such disorder in my wit.</div>
                     <div class="line">O Lord! my boy, my Arthur, my fair son!</div>
                     <div class="line">My life, my joy, my food, my all the world!</div>
                     <div class="line">My widow-comfort, and my sorrows' cure!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                     <div class="line">I fear some outrage, and I'll follow her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">There's nothing in this world can make me joy:</div>
                     <div class="line">Life is as tedious as a twice-told tale</div>
                     <div class="line">Vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bitter shame hath spoil'd the sweet world's taste</div>
                     <div class="line">That it yields nought but shame and bitterness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the curing of a strong disease,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the instant of repair and health,</div>
                     <div class="line">The fit is strongest; evils that take leave,</div>
                     <div class="line">On their departure most of all show evil:</div>
                     <div class="line">What have you lost by losing of this day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">All days of glory, joy and happiness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">If you had won it, certainly you had.</div>
                     <div class="line">No, no; when Fortune means to men most good,</div>
                     <div class="line">She looks upon them with a threatening eye.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis strange to think how much King John hath lost</div>
                     <div class="line">In this which he accounts so clearly won:</div>
                     <div class="line">Are not you grieved that Arthur is his prisoner?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">As heartily as he is glad he hath him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">Your mind is all as youthful as your blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now hear me speak with a prophetic spirit;</div>
                     <div class="line">For even the breath of what I mean to speak</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall blow each dust, each straw, each little rub,</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the path which shall directly lead</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy foot to England's throne; and therefore mark.</div>
                     <div class="line">John hath seized Arthur; and it cannot be</div>
                     <div class="line">That, whiles warm life plays in that infant's veins,</div>
                     <div class="line">The misplaced John should entertain an hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">One minute, nay, one quiet breath of rest.</div>
                     <div class="line">A sceptre snatch'd with an unruly hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Must be as boisterously maintain'd as gain'd;</div>
                     <div class="line">And he that stands upon a slippery place</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes nice of no vile hold to stay him up:</div>
                     <div class="line">That John may stand, then Arthur needs must fall;</div>
                     <div class="line">So be it, for it cannot be but so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">But what shall I gain by young Arthur's fall?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">You, in the right of Lady Blanch your wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">May then make all the claim that Arthur did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">And lose it, life and all, as Arthur did.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">How green you are and fresh in this old world!</div>
                     <div class="line">John lays you plots; the times conspire with you;</div>
                     <div class="line">For he that steeps his safety in true blood</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall find but bloody safety and untrue.</div>
                     <div class="line">This act so evilly born shall cool the hearts</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all his people and freeze up their zeal,</div>
                     <div class="line">That none so small advantage shall step forth</div>
                     <div class="line">To cheque his reign, but they will cherish it;</div>
                     <div class="line">No natural exhalation in the sky,</div>
                     <div class="line">No scope of nature, no distemper'd day,</div>
                     <div class="line">No common wind, no customed event,</div>
                     <div class="line">But they will pluck away his natural cause</div>
                     <div class="line">And call them meteors, prodigies and signs,</div>
                     <div class="line">Abortives, presages and tongues of heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">Plainly denouncing vengeance upon John.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">May be he will not touch young Arthur's life,</div>
                     <div class="line">But hold himself safe in his prisonment.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                     <div class="line">O, sir, when he shall hear of your approach,</div>
                     <div class="line">If that young Arthur be not gone already,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even at that news he dies; and then the hearts</div>
                     <div class="line">Of all his people shall revolt from him</div>
                     <div class="line">And kiss the lips of unacquainted change</div>
                     <div class="line">And pick strong matter of revolt and wrath</div>
                     <div class="line">Out of the bloody fingers' ends of John.</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks I see this hurly all on foot:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, O, what better matter breeds for you</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I have named! The bastard Faulconbridge</div>
                     <div class="line">Is now in England, ransacking the church,</div>
                     <div class="line">Offending charity: if but a dozen French</div>
                     <div class="line">Were there in arms, they would be as a call</div>
                     <div class="line">To train ten thousand English to their side,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or as a little snow, tumbled about,</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon becomes a mountain. O noble Dauphin,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go with me to the king: 'tis wonderful</div>
                     <div class="line">What may be wrought out of their discontent,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now that their souls are topful of offence.</div>
                     <div class="line">For England go: I will whet on the king.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                     <div class="line">Strong reasons make strong actions: let us go:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you say ay, the king will not say no.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.6">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 4. ACT IV</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.2">1. SCENE I.  A room in a castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.3">2. SCENE II.  KING JOHN'S palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.6.4">3. SCENE III.  Before the castle.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A room in a castle.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HUBERT and Executioners</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Heat me these irons hot; and look thou stand</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the arras: when I strike my foot</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the bosom of the ground, rush forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">And bind the boy which you shall find with me</div>
                     <div class="line">Fast to the chair: be heedful: hence, and watch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Executioner</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope your warrant will bear out the deed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Uncleanly scruples! fear not you: look to't.</div>
                     <p>Exeunt Executioners</p>
                     <div class="line">Young lad, come forth; I have to say with you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ARTHUR</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, Hubert.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Good morrow, little prince.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">As little prince, having so great a title</div>
                     <div class="line">To be more prince, as may be. You are sad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, I have been merrier.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Mercy on me!</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks no body should be sad but I:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, I remember, when I was in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">Young gentlemen would be as sad as night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Only for wantonness. By my christendom,</div>
                     <div class="line">So I were out of prison and kept sheep,</div>
                     <div class="line">I should be as merry as the day is long;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so I would be here, but that I doubt</div>
                     <div class="line">My uncle practises more harm to me:</div>
                     <div class="line">He is afraid of me and I of him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Is it my fault that I was Geffrey's son?</div>
                     <div class="line">No, indeed, is't not; and I would to heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">I were your son, so you would love me, Hubert.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  If I talk to him, with his innocent prate</div>
                     <div class="line">He will awake my mercy which lies dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I will be sudden and dispatch.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you sick, Hubert? you look pale to-day:</div>
                     <div class="line">In sooth, I would you were a little sick,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I might sit all night and watch with you:</div>
                     <div class="line">I warrant I love you more than you do me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  His words do take possession of my bosom.</div>
                     <div class="line">Read here, young Arthur.</div>
                     <p>Showing a paper</p>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">How now, foolish rheum!</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning dispiteous torture out of door!</div>
                     <div class="line">I must be brief, lest resolution drop</div>
                     <div class="line">Out at mine eyes in tender womanish tears.</div>
                     <div class="line">Can you not read it? Is it not fair writ?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Too fairly, Hubert, for so foul effect:</div>
                     <div class="line">Must you with hot irons burn out both mine eyes?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Young boy, I must.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">And will you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Have you the heart? When your head did but ache,</div>
                     <div class="line">I knit my handercher about your brows,</div>
                     <div class="line">The best I had, a princess wrought it me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I did never ask it you again;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with my hand at midnight held your head,</div>
                     <div class="line">And like the watchful minutes to the hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still and anon cheer'd up the heavy time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Saying, 'What lack you?' and 'Where lies your grief?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Or 'What good love may I perform for you?'</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a poor man's son would have lien still</div>
                     <div class="line">And ne'er have spoke a loving word to you;</div>
                     <div class="line">But you at your sick service had a prince.</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, you may think my love was crafty love</div>
                     <div class="line">And call it cunning: do, an if you will:</div>
                     <div class="line">If heaven be pleased that you must use me ill,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then you must. Will you put out mine eyes?</div>
                     <div class="line">These eyes that never did nor never shall</div>
                     <div class="line">So much as frown on you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">I have sworn to do it;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with hot irons must I burn them out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, none but in this iron age would do it!</div>
                     <div class="line">The iron of itself, though heat red-hot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Approaching near these eyes, would drink my tears</div>
                     <div class="line">And quench his fiery indignation</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the matter of mine innocence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, after that, consume away in rust</div>
                     <div class="line">But for containing fire to harm mine eye.</div>
                     <div class="line">Are you more stubborn-hard than hammer'd iron?</div>
                     <div class="line">An if an angel should have come to me</div>
                     <div class="line">And told me Hubert should put out mine eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would not have believed him,--no tongue but Hubert's.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Come forth.</div>
                     <p>Stamps</p>
                     <p>Re-enter Executioners, with a cord, irons, &c</p>
                     <div class="line">Do as I bid you do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, save me, Hubert, save me! my eyes are out</div>
                     <div class="line">Even with the fierce looks of these bloody men.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Give me the iron, I say, and bind him here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, what need you be so boisterous-rough?</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not struggle, I will stand stone-still.</div>
                     <div class="line">For heaven sake, Hubert, let me not be bound!</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, hear me, Hubert, drive these men away,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I will sit as quiet as a lamb;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not stir, nor wince, nor speak a word,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor look upon the iron angerly:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thrust but these men away, and I'll forgive you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whatever torment you do put me to.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, stand within; let me alone with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Executioner</div>
                     <div class="line">I am best pleased to be from such a deed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Executioners</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Alas, I then have chid away my friend!</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath a stern look, but a gentle heart:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him come back, that his compassion may</div>
                     <div class="line">Give life to yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, boy, prepare yourself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Is there no remedy?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">None, but to lose your eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O heaven, that there were but a mote in yours,</div>
                     <div class="line">A grain, a dust, a gnat, a wandering hair,</div>
                     <div class="line">Any annoyance in that precious sense!</div>
                     <div class="line">Then feeling what small things are boisterous there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your vile intent must needs seem horrible.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Is this your promise? go to, hold your tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">Hubert, the utterance of a brace of tongues</div>
                     <div class="line">Must needs want pleading for a pair of eyes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me not hold my tongue, let me not, Hubert;</div>
                     <div class="line">Or, Hubert, if you will, cut out my tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">So I may keep mine eyes: O, spare mine eyes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Though to no use but still to look on you!</div>
                     <div class="line">Lo, by my truth, the instrument is cold</div>
                     <div class="line">And would not harm me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">I can heat it, boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">No, in good sooth: the fire is dead with grief,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being create for comfort, to be used</div>
                     <div class="line">In undeserved extremes: see else yourself;</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no malice in this burning coal;</div>
                     <div class="line">The breath of heaven has blown his spirit out</div>
                     <div class="line">And strew'd repentent ashes on his head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">But with my breath I can revive it, boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">An if you do, you will but make it blush</div>
                     <div class="line">And glow with shame of your proceedings, Hubert:</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, it perchance will sparkle in your eyes;</div>
                     <div class="line">And like a dog that is compell'd to fight,</div>
                     <div class="line">Snatch at his master that doth tarre him on.</div>
                     <div class="line">All things that you should use to do me wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">Deny their office: only you do lack</div>
                     <div class="line">That mercy which fierce fire and iron extends,</div>
                     <div class="line">Creatures of note for mercy-lacking uses.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, see to live; I will not touch thine eye</div>
                     <div class="line">For all the treasure that thine uncle owes:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet am I sworn and I did purpose, boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">With this same very iron to burn them out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O, now you look like Hubert! all this while</div>
                     <div class="line">You were disguised.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace; no more. Adieu.</div>
                     <div class="line">Your uncle must not know but you are dead;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll fill these dogged spies with false reports:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, pretty child, sleep doubtless and secure,</div>
                     <div class="line">That Hubert, for the wealth of all the world,</div>
                     <div class="line">Will not offend thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                     <div class="line">O heaven! I thank you, Hubert.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                     <div class="line">Silence; no more: go closely in with me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Much danger do I undergo for thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  KING JOHN'S palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter KING JOHN, PEMBROKE, SALISBURY, and other Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Here once again we sit, once again crown'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And looked upon, I hope, with cheerful eyes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">This 'once again,' but that your highness pleased,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was once superfluous: you were crown'd before,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that high royalty was ne'er pluck'd off,</div>
                     <div class="line">The faiths of men ne'er stained with revolt;</div>
                     <div class="line">Fresh expectation troubled not the land</div>
                     <div class="line">With any long'd-for change or better state.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, to be possess'd with double pomp,</div>
                     <div class="line">To guard a title that was rich before,</div>
                     <div class="line">To gild refined gold, to paint the lily,</div>
                     <div class="line">To throw a perfume on the violet,</div>
                     <div class="line">To smooth the ice, or add another hue</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the rainbow, or with taper-light</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek the beauteous eye of heaven to garnish,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is wasteful and ridiculous excess.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">But that your royal pleasure must be done,</div>
                     <div class="line">This act is as an ancient tale new told,</div>
                     <div class="line">And in the last repeating troublesome,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being urged at a time unseasonable.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">In this the antique and well noted face</div>
                     <div class="line">Of plain old form is much disfigured;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, like a shifted wind unto a sail,</div>
                     <div class="line">It makes the course of thoughts to fetch about,</div>
                     <div class="line">Startles and frights consideration,</div>
                     <div class="line">Makes sound opinion sick and truth suspected,</div>
                     <div class="line">For putting on so new a fashion'd robe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">When workmen strive to do better than well,</div>
                     <div class="line">They do confound their skill in covetousness;</div>
                     <div class="line">And oftentimes excusing of a fault</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth make the fault the worse by the excuse,</div>
                     <div class="line">As patches set upon a little breach</div>
                     <div class="line">Discredit more in hiding of the fault</div>
                     <div class="line">Than did the fault before it was so patch'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">To this effect, before you were new crown'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">We breathed our counsel: but it pleased your highness</div>
                     <div class="line">To overbear it, and we are all well pleased,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since all and every part of what we would</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth make a stand at what your highness will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Some reasons of this double coronation</div>
                     <div class="line">I have possess'd you with and think them strong;</div>
                     <div class="line">And more, more strong, then lesser is my fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall indue you with: meantime but ask</div>
                     <div class="line">What you would have reform'd that is not well,</div>
                     <div class="line">And well shall you perceive how willingly</div>
                     <div class="line">I will both hear and grant you your requests.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I, as one that am the tongue of these,</div>
                     <div class="line">To sound the purpose of all their hearts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Both for myself and them, but, chief of all,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your safety, for the which myself and them</div>
                     <div class="line">Bend their best studies, heartily request</div>
                     <div class="line">The enfranchisement of Arthur; whose restraint</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth move the murmuring lips of discontent</div>
                     <div class="line">To break into this dangerous argument,--</div>
                     <div class="line">If what in rest you have in right you hold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then your fears, which, as they say, attend</div>
                     <div class="line">The steps of wrong, should move you to mew up</div>
                     <div class="line">Your tender kinsman and to choke his days</div>
                     <div class="line">With barbarous ignorance and deny his youth</div>
                     <div class="line">The rich advantage of good exercise?</div>
                     <div class="line">That the time's enemies may not have this</div>
                     <div class="line">To grace occasions, let it be our suit</div>
                     <div class="line">That you have bid us ask his liberty;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which for our goods we do no further ask</div>
                     <div class="line">Than whereupon our weal, on you depending,</div>
                     <div class="line">Counts it your weal he have his liberty.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter HUBERT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be so: I do commit his youth</div>
                     <div class="line">To your direction. Hubert, what news with you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Taking him apart</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the man should do the bloody deed;</div>
                     <div class="line">He show'd his warrant to a friend of mine:</div>
                     <div class="line">The image of a wicked heinous fault</div>
                     <div class="line">Lives in his eye; that close aspect of his</div>
                     <div class="line">Does show the mood of a much troubled breast;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I do fearfully believe 'tis done,</div>
                     <div class="line">What we so fear'd he had a charge to do.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">The colour of the king doth come and go</div>
                     <div class="line">Between his purpose and his conscience,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like heralds 'twixt two dreadful battles set:</div>
                     <div class="line">His passion is so ripe, it needs must break.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">And when it breaks, I fear will issue thence</div>
                     <div class="line">The foul corruption of a sweet child's death.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">We cannot hold mortality's strong hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">Good lords, although my will to give is living,</div>
                     <div class="line">The suit which you demand is gone and dead:</div>
                     <div class="line">He tells us Arthur is deceased to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed we fear'd his sickness was past cure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed we heard how near his death he was</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the child himself felt he was sick:</div>
                     <div class="line">This must be answer'd either here or hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Why do you bend such solemn brows on me?</div>
                     <div class="line">Think you I bear the shears of destiny?</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I commandment on the pulse of life?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                     <div class="line">It is apparent foul play; and 'tis shame</div>
                     <div class="line">That greatness should so grossly offer it:</div>
                     <div class="line">So thrive it in your game! and so, farewell.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay yet, Lord Salisbury; I'll go with thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">And find the inheritance of this poor child,</div>
                     <div class="line">His little kingdom of a forced grave.</div>
                     <div class="line">That blood which owed the breadth of all this isle,</div>
                     <div class="line">Three foot of it doth hold: bad world the while!</div>
                     <div class="line">This must not be thus borne: this will break out</div>
                     <div class="line">To all our sorrows, and ere long I doubt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Lords</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">They burn in indignation. I repent:</div>
                     <div class="line">There is no sure foundation set on blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">No certain life achieved by others' death.</div>
                     <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                     <div class="line">A fearful eye thou hast: where is that blood</div>
                     <div class="line">That I have seen inhabit in those cheeks?</div>
                     <div class="line">So foul a sky clears not without a storm:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pour down thy weather: how goes all in France?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">From France to England. Never such a power</div>
                     <div class="line">For any foreign preparation</div>
                     <div class="line">Was levied in the body of a land.</div>
                     <div class="line">The copy of your speed is learn'd by them;</div>
                     <div class="line">For when you should be told they do prepare,</div>
                     <div class="line">The tidings come that they are all arrived.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">O, where hath our intelligence been drunk?</div>
                     <div class="line">Where hath it slept? Where is my mother's care,</div>
                     <div class="line">That such an army could be drawn in France,</div>
                     <div class="line">And she not hear of it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, her ear</div>
                     <div class="line">Is stopp'd with dust; the first of April died</div>
                     <div class="line">Your noble mother: and, as I hear, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">The Lady Constance in a frenzy died</div>
                     <div class="line">Three days before: but this from rumour's tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">I idly heard; if true or false I know not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Withhold thy speed, dreadful occasion!</div>
                     <div class="line">O, make a league with me, till I have pleased</div>
                     <div class="line">My discontented peers! What! mother dead!</div>
                     <div class="line">How wildly then walks my estate in France!</div>
                     <div class="line">Under whose conduct came those powers of France</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou for truth givest out are landed here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the Dauphin.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou hast made me giddy</div>
                     <div class="line">With these ill tidings.</div>
                     <p>Enter the BASTARD and PETER of Pomfret</p>
                     <div class="line">Now, what says the world</div>
                     <div class="line">To your proceedings? do not seek to stuff</div>
                     <div class="line">My head with more ill news, for it is full.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">But if you be afeard to hear the worst,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let the worst unheard fall on your bead.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Bear with me cousin, for I was amazed</div>
                     <div class="line">Under the tide: but now I breathe again</div>
                     <div class="line">Aloft the flood, and can give audience</div>
                     <div class="line">To any tongue, speak it of what it will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                     <div class="line">How I have sped among the clergymen,</div>
                     <div class="line">The sums I have collected shall express.</div>
                     <div class="line">But as I travell'd hither through the land,</div>
                     <div class="line">I find the people strangely fantasied;</div>
                     <div class="line">Possess'd with rumours, full of idle dreams,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not knowing what they fear, but full of fear:</div>
                     <div class="line">And here a prophet, that I brought with me</div>
                     <div class="line">From forth the streets of Pomfret, whom I found</div>
                     <div class="line">With many hundreds treading on his heels;</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom he sung, in rude harsh-sounding rhymes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, ere the next Ascension-day at noon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your highness should deliver up your crown.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou idle dreamer, wherefore didst thou so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PETER</div>
                     <div class="line">Foreknowing that the truth will fall out so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                     <div class="line">Hubert, away with him; imprison him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And on that day at noon whereon he says</div>
                     <div class="line">I shall yield up my crown, let him be hang'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">Deliver him to safety; and return,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I must use thee.</div>
