                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">The peace of heaven is theirs that lift their swords</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a just and charitable war.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Well then, to work: our cannon shall be bent</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the brows of this resisting town.</div>
                              <div class="line">Call for our chiefest men of discipline,</div>
                              <div class="line">To cull the plots of best advantages:</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll lay before this town our royal bones,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wade to the market-place in Frenchmen's blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">But we will make it subject to this boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Stay for an answer to your embassy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest unadvised you stain your swords with blood:</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord Chatillon may from England bring,</div>
                              <div class="line">That right in peace which here we urge in war,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then we shall repent each drop of blood</div>
                              <div class="line">That hot rash haste so indirectly shed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter CHATILLON</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">A wonder, lady! lo, upon thy wish,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our messenger Chatillon is arrived!</div>
                              <div class="line">What England says, say briefly, gentle lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">We coldly pause for thee; Chatillon, speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CHATILLON</div>
                              <div class="line">Then turn your forces from this paltry siege</div>
                              <div class="line">And stir them up against a mightier task.</div>
                              <div class="line">England, impatient of your just demands,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath put himself in arms: the adverse winds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose leisure I have stay'd, have given him time</div>
                              <div class="line">To land his legions all as soon as I;</div>
                              <div class="line">His marches are expedient to this town,</div>
                              <div class="line">His forces strong, his soldiers confident.</div>
                              <div class="line">With him along is come the mother-queen,</div>
                              <div class="line">An Ate, stirring him to blood and strife;</div>
                              <div class="line">With her her niece, the Lady Blanch of Spain;</div>
                              <div class="line">With them a bastard of the king's deceased,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all the unsettled humours of the land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rash, inconsiderate, fiery voluntaries,</div>
                              <div class="line">With ladies' faces and fierce dragons' spleens,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have sold their fortunes at their native homes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bearing their birthrights proudly on their backs,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make hazard of new fortunes here:</div>
                              <div class="line">In brief, a braver choice of dauntless spirits</div>
                              <div class="line">Than now the English bottoms have waft o'er</div>
                              <div class="line">Did nearer float upon the swelling tide,</div>
                              <div class="line">To do offence and scath in Christendom.</div>
                              <p>Drum beats</p>
                              <div class="line">The interruption of their churlish drums</div>
                              <div class="line">Cuts off more circumstance: they are at hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">To parley or to fight; therefore prepare.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">How much unlook'd for is this expedition!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">By how much unexpected, by so much</div>
                              <div class="line">We must awake endavour for defence;</div>
                              <div class="line">For courage mounteth with occasion:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let them be welcome then: we are prepared.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter KING JOHN, QUEEN ELINOR, BLANCH, the BASTARD,
Lords, and forces</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace be to France, if France in peace permit</div>
                              <div class="line">Our just and lineal entrance to our own;</div>
                              <div class="line">If not, bleed France, and peace ascend to heaven,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles we, God's wrathful agent, do correct</div>
                              <div class="line">Their proud contempt that beats His peace to heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace be to England, if that war return</div>
                              <div class="line">From France to England, there to live in peace.</div>
                              <div class="line">England we love; and for that England's sake</div>
                              <div class="line">With burden of our armour here we sweat.</div>
                              <div class="line">This toil of ours should be a work of thine;</div>
                              <div class="line">But thou from loving England art so far,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou hast under-wrought his lawful king</div>
                              <div class="line">Cut off the sequence of posterity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Out-faced infant state and done a rape</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the maiden virtue of the crown.</div>
                              <div class="line">Look here upon thy brother Geffrey's face;</div>
                              <div class="line">These eyes, these brows, were moulded out of his:</div>
                              <div class="line">This little abstract doth contain that large</div>
                              <div class="line">Which died in Geffrey, and the hand of time</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall draw this brief into as huge a volume.</div>
                              <div class="line">That Geffrey was thy elder brother born,</div>
                              <div class="line">And this his son; England was Geffrey's right</div>
                              <div class="line">And this is Geffrey's: in the name of God</div>
                              <div class="line">How comes it then that thou art call'd a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">When living blood doth in these temples beat,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which owe the crown that thou o'ermasterest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">From whom hast thou this great commission, France,</div>
                              <div class="line">To draw my answer from thy articles?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">From that supernal judge, that stirs good thoughts</div>
                              <div class="line">In any breast of strong authority,</div>
                              <div class="line">To look into the blots and stains of right:</div>
                              <div class="line">That judge hath made me guardian to this boy:</div>
                              <div class="line">Under whose warrant I impeach thy wrong</div>
                              <div class="line">And by whose help I mean to chastise it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack, thou dost usurp authority.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Excuse; it is to beat usurping down.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Who is it thou dost call usurper, France?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me make answer; thy usurping son.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, insolent! thy bastard shall be king,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thou mayst be a queen, and cheque the world!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">My bed was ever to thy son as true</div>
                              <div class="line">As thine was to thy husband; and this boy</div>
                              <div class="line">Liker in feature to his father Geffrey</div>
                              <div class="line">Than thou and John in manners; being as like</div>
                              <div class="line">As rain to water, or devil to his dam.</div>
                              <div class="line">My boy a bastard! By my soul, I think</div>
                              <div class="line">His father never was so true begot:</div>
                              <div class="line">It cannot be, an if thou wert his mother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">There's a good mother, boy, that blots thy father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">There's a good grandam, boy, that would blot thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear the crier.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What the devil art thou?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">One that will play the devil, sir, with you,</div>
                              <div class="line">An a' may catch your hide and you alone:</div>
                              <div class="line">You are the hare of whom the proverb goes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose valour plucks dead lions by the beard;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll smoke your skin-coat, an I catch you right;</div>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, look to't; i' faith, I will, i' faith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                              <div class="line">O, well did he become that lion's robe</div>
                              <div class="line">That did disrobe the lion of that robe!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">It lies as sightly on the back of him</div>
                              <div class="line">As great Alcides' shows upon an ass:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, ass, I'll take that burthen from your back,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or lay on that shall make your shoulders crack.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What craker is this same that deafs our ears</div>
                              <div class="line">With this abundance of superfluous breath?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Lewis, determine what we shall do straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Women and fools, break off your conference.</div>
                              <div class="line">King John, this is the very sum of all;</div>
                              <div class="line">England and Ireland, Anjou, Touraine, Maine,</div>
                              <div class="line">In right of Arthur do I claim of thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Wilt thou resign them and lay down thy arms?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">My life as soon: I do defy thee, France.</div>
                              <div class="line">Arthur of Bretagne, yield thee to my hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">And out of my dear love I'll give thee more</div>
                              <div class="line">Than e'er the coward hand of France can win:</div>
                              <div class="line">Submit thee, boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Come to thy grandam, child.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Do, child, go to it grandam, child:</div>
                              <div class="line">Give grandam kingdom, and it grandam will</div>
                              <div class="line">Give it a plum, a cherry, and a fig:</div>
                              <div class="line">There's a good grandam.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ARTHUR</div>
                              <div class="line">Good my mother, peace!</div>
                              <div class="line">I would that I were low laid in my grave:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not worth this coil that's made for me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">His mother shames him so, poor boy, he weeps.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Now shame upon you, whether she does or no!</div>
                              <div class="line">His grandam's wrongs, and not his mother's shames,</div>
                              <div class="line">Draws those heaven-moving pearls from his poor eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which heaven shall take in nature of a fee;</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, with these crystal beads heaven shall be bribed</div>
                              <div class="line">To do him justice and revenge on you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou monstrous slanderer of heaven and earth!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou monstrous injurer of heaven and earth!</div>
                              <div class="line">Call not me slanderer; thou and thine usurp</div>
                              <div class="line">The dominations, royalties and rights</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this oppressed boy: this is thy eld'st son's son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Infortunate in nothing but in thee:</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy sins are visited in this poor child;</div>
                              <div class="line">The canon of the law is laid on him,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being but the second generation</div>
                              <div class="line">Removed from thy sin-conceiving womb.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Bedlam, have done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">I have but this to say,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he is not only plagued for her sin,</div>
                              <div class="line">But God hath made her sin and her the plague</div>
                              <div class="line">On this removed issue, plague for her</div>
                              <div class="line">And with her plague; her sin his injury,</div>
                              <div class="line">Her injury the beadle to her sin,</div>
                              <div class="line">All punish'd in the person of this child,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all for her; a plague upon her!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou unadvised scold, I can produce</div>
                              <div class="line">A will that bars the title of thy son.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CONSTANCE</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, who doubts that? a will! a wicked will:</div>
                              <div class="line">A woman's will; a canker'd grandam's will!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, lady! pause, or be more temperate:</div>
                              <div class="line">It ill beseems this presence to cry aim</div>
                              <div class="line">To these ill-tuned repetitions.</div>
                              <div class="line">Some trumpet summon hither to the walls</div>
                              <div class="line">These men of Angiers: let us hear them speak</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose title they admit, Arthur's or John's.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Trumpet sounds. Enter certain Citizens upon the walls</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Who is it that hath warn'd us to the walls?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis France, for England.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">England, for itself.</div>
                              <div class="line">You men of Angiers, and my loving subjects--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">You loving men of Angiers, Arthur's subjects,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our trumpet call'd you to this gentle parle--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">For our advantage; therefore hear us first.</div>
                              <div class="line">These flags of France, that are advanced here</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the eye and prospect of your town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Have hither march'd to your endamagement:</div>
                              <div class="line">The cannons have their bowels full of wrath,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ready mounted are they to spit forth</div>
                              <div class="line">Their iron indignation 'gainst your walls:</div>
                              <div class="line">All preparation for a bloody siege</div>
                              <div class="line">All merciless proceeding by these French</div>
                              <div class="line">Confronts your city's eyes, your winking gates;</div>
                              <div class="line">And but for our approach those sleeping stones,</div>
                              <div class="line">That as a waist doth girdle you about,</div>
                              <div class="line">By the compulsion of their ordinance</div>
                              <div class="line">By this time from their fixed beds of lime</div>
                              <div class="line">Had been dishabited, and wide havoc made</div>
                              <div class="line">For bloody power to rush upon your peace.</div>
                              <div class="line">But on the sight of us your lawful king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who painfully with much expedient march</div>
                              <div class="line">Have brought a countercheque before your gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">To save unscratch'd your city's threatened cheeks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold, the French amazed vouchsafe a parle;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now, instead of bullets wrapp'd in fire,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make a shaking fever in your walls,</div>
                              <div class="line">They shoot but calm words folded up in smoke,</div>
                              <div class="line">To make a faithless error in your ears:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which trust accordingly, kind citizens,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let us in, your king, whose labour'd spirits,</div>
                              <div class="line">Forwearied in this action of swift speed,</div>
                              <div class="line">Crave harbourage within your city walls.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">When I have said, make answer to us both.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lo, in this right hand, whose protection</div>
                              <div class="line">Is most divinely vow'd upon the right</div>
                              <div class="line">Of him it holds, stands young Plantagenet,</div>
                              <div class="line">Son to the elder brother of this man,</div>
                              <div class="line">And king o'er him and all that he enjoys:</div>
                              <div class="line">For this down-trodden equity, we tread</div>
                              <div class="line">In warlike march these greens before your town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being no further enemy to you</div>
                              <div class="line">Than the constraint of hospitable zeal</div>
                              <div class="line">In the relief of this oppressed child</div>
                              <div class="line">Religiously provokes. Be pleased then</div>
                              <div class="line">To pay that duty which you truly owe</div>
                              <div class="line">To that owes it, namely this young prince:</div>
                              <div class="line">And then our arms, like to a muzzled bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Save in aspect, hath all offence seal'd up;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our cannons' malice vainly shall be spent</div>
                              <div class="line">Against the invulnerable clouds of heaven;</div>
                              <div class="line">And with a blessed and unvex'd retire,</div>
                              <div class="line">With unhack'd swords and helmets all unbruised,</div>
                              <div class="line">We will bear home that lusty blood again</div>
                              <div class="line">Which here we came to spout against your town,</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave your children, wives and you in peace.</div>
                              <div class="line">But if you fondly pass our proffer'd offer,</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not the roundure of your old-faced walls</div>
                              <div class="line">Can hide you from our messengers of war,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though all these English and their discipline</div>
                              <div class="line">Were harbour'd in their rude circumference.</div>
                              <div class="line">Then tell us, shall your city call us lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">In that behalf which we have challenged it?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or shall we give the signal to our rage</div>
                              <div class="line">And stalk in blood to our possession?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">In brief, we are the king of England's subjects:</div>
                              <div class="line">For him, and in his right, we hold this town.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Acknowledge then the king, and let me in.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">That can we not; but he that proves the king,</div>
                              <div class="line">To him will we prove loyal: till that time</div>
                              <div class="line">Have we ramm'd up our gates against the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth not the crown of England prove the king?</div>
                              <div class="line">And if not that, I bring you witnesses,</div>
                              <div class="line">Twice fifteen thousand hearts of England's breed,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Bastards, and else.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">To verify our title with their lives.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">As many and as well-born bloods as those,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Some bastards too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand in his face to contradict his claim.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Till you compound whose right is worthiest,</div>
                              <div class="line">We for the worthiest hold the right from both.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Then God forgive the sin of all those souls</div>
                              <div class="line">That to their everlasting residence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the dew of evening fall, shall fleet,</div>
                              <div class="line">In dreadful trial of our kingdom's king!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Amen, amen! Mount, chevaliers! to arms!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Saint George, that swinged the dragon, and e'er since</div>
                              <div class="line">Sits on his horseback at mine hostess' door,</div>
                              <div class="line">Teach us some fence!</div>
                              <p>To AUSTRIA</p>
                              <div class="line">Sirrah, were I at home,</div>
                              <div class="line">At your den, sirrah, with your lioness</div>
                              <div class="line">I would set an ox-head to your lion's hide,</div>
                              <div class="line">And make a monster of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace! no more.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">O tremble, for you hear the lion roar.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Up higher to the plain; where we'll set forth</div>
                              <div class="line">In best appointment all our regiments.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Speed then, to take advantage of the field.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">It shall be so; and at the other hill</div>
                              <div class="line">Command the rest to stand. God and our right!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                        <p>Here after excursions, enter the Herald of France,
with trumpets, to the gates</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">French Herald</div>
                              <div class="line">You men of Angiers, open wide your gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let young Arthur, Duke of Bretagne, in,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who by the hand of France this day hath made</div>
                              <div class="line">Much work for tears in many an English mother,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose sons lie scattered on the bleeding ground;</div>
                              <div class="line">Many a widow's husband grovelling lies,</div>
                              <div class="line">Coldly embracing the discolour'd earth;</div>
                              <div class="line">And victory, with little loss, doth play</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the dancing banners of the French,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who are at hand, triumphantly display'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">To enter conquerors and to proclaim</div>
                              <div class="line">Arthur of Bretagne England's king and yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter English Herald, with trumpet</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">English Herald</div>
                              <div class="line">Rejoice, you men of Angiers, ring your bells:</div>
                              <div class="line">King John, your king and England's doth approach,</div>
                              <div class="line">Commander of this hot malicious day:</div>
                              <div class="line">Their armours, that march'd hence so silver-bright,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hither return all gilt with Frenchmen's blood;</div>
                              <div class="line">There stuck no plume in any English crest</div>
                              <div class="line">That is removed by a staff of France;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our colours do return in those same hands</div>
                              <div class="line">That did display them when we first march'd forth;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, like a troop of jolly huntsmen, come</div>
                              <div class="line">Our lusty English, all with purpled hands,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dyed in the dying slaughter of their foes:</div>
                              <div class="line">Open your gates and gives the victors way.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Heralds, from off our towers we might behold,</div>
                              <div class="line">From first to last, the onset and retire</div>
                              <div class="line">Of both your armies; whose equality</div>
                              <div class="line">By our best eyes cannot be censured:</div>
                              <div class="line">Blood hath bought blood and blows have answered blows;</div>
                              <div class="line">Strength match'd with strength, and power confronted power:</div>
                              <div class="line">Both are alike; and both alike we like.</div>
                              <div class="line">One must prove greatest: while they weigh so even,</div>
                              <div class="line">We hold our town for neither, yet for both.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Re-enter KING JOHN and KING PHILIP, with their
powers, severally</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">France, hast thou yet more blood to cast away?</div>
                              <div class="line">Say, shall the current of our right run on?</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose passage, vex'd with thy impediment,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall leave his native channel and o'erswell</div>
                              <div class="line">With course disturb'd even thy confining shores,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless thou let his silver water keep</div>
                              <div class="line">A peaceful progress to the ocean.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">England, thou hast not saved one drop of blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">In this hot trial, more than we of France;</div>
                              <div class="line">Rather, lost more. And by this hand I swear,</div>
                              <div class="line">That sways the earth this climate overlooks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before we will lay down our just-borne arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll put thee down, 'gainst whom these arms we bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or add a royal number to the dead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gracing the scroll that tells of this war's loss</div>
                              <div class="line">With slaughter coupled to the name of kings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha, majesty! how high thy glory towers,</div>
                              <div class="line">When the rich blood of kings is set on fire!</div>
                              <div class="line">O, now doth Death line his dead chaps with steel;</div>
                              <div class="line">The swords of soldiers are his teeth, his fangs;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now he feasts, mousing the flesh of men,</div>
                              <div class="line">In undetermined differences of kings.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why stand these royal fronts amazed thus?</div>
                              <div class="line">Cry, 'havoc!' kings; back to the stained field,</div>
                              <div class="line">You equal potents, fiery kindled spirits!</div>
                              <div class="line">Then let confusion of one part confirm</div>
                              <div class="line">The other's peace: till then, blows, blood and death!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose party do the townsmen yet admit?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak, citizens, for England; who's your king?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">The king of England; when we know the king.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Know him in us, that here hold up his right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">In us, that are our own great deputy</div>
                              <div class="line">And bear possession of our person here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord of our presence, Angiers, and of you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">A greater power then we denies all this;</div>
                              <div class="line">And till it be undoubted, we do lock</div>
                              <div class="line">Our former scruple in our strong-barr'd gates;</div>
                              <div class="line">King'd of our fears, until our fears, resolved,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be by some certain king purged and deposed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, these scroyles of Angiers flout you, kings,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stand securely on their battlements,</div>
                              <div class="line">As in a theatre, whence they gape and point</div>
                              <div class="line">At your industrious scenes and acts of death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your royal presences be ruled by me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Do like the mutines of Jerusalem,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be friends awhile and both conjointly bend</div>
                              <div class="line">Your sharpest deeds of malice on this town:</div>
                              <div class="line">By east and west let France and England mount</div>
                              <div class="line">Their battering cannon charged to the mouths,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till their soul-fearing clamours have brawl'd down</div>
                              <div class="line">The flinty ribs of this contemptuous city:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'ld play incessantly upon these jades,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even till unfenced desolation</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave them as naked as the vulgar air.</div>
                              <div class="line">That done, dissever your united strengths,</div>
                              <div class="line">And part your mingled colours once again;</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn face to face and bloody point to point;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, in a moment, Fortune shall cull forth</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of one side her happy minion,</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom in favour she shall give the day,</div>
                              <div class="line">And kiss him with a glorious victory.</div>
                              <div class="line">How like you this wild counsel, mighty states?</div>
                              <div class="line">Smacks it not something of the policy?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by the sky that hangs above our heads,</div>
                              <div class="line">I like it well. France, shall we knit our powers</div>
                              <div class="line">And lay this Angiers even to the ground;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then after fight who shall be king of it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">An if thou hast the mettle of a king,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being wronged as we are by this peevish town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn thou the mouth of thy artillery,</div>
                              <div class="line">As we will ours, against these saucy walls;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when that we have dash'd them to the ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">Why then defy each other and pell-mell</div>
                              <div class="line">Make work upon ourselves, for heaven or hell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it be so. Say, where will you assault?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">We from the west will send destruction</div>
                              <div class="line">Into this city's bosom.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I from the north.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Our thunder from the south</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall rain their drift of bullets on this town.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">O prudent discipline! From north to south:</div>
                              <div class="line">Austria and France shoot in each other's mouth:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll stir them to it. Come, away, away!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear us, great kings: vouchsafe awhile to stay,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I shall show you peace and fair-faced league;</div>
                              <div class="line">Win you this city without stroke or wound;</div>
                              <div class="line">Rescue those breathing lives to die in beds,</div>
                              <div class="line">That here come sacrifices for the field:</div>
                              <div class="line">Persever not, but hear me, mighty kings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak on with favour; we are bent to hear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">That daughter there of Spain, the Lady Blanch,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is niece to England: look upon the years</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Lewis the Dauphin and that lovely maid:</div>
                              <div class="line">If lusty love should go in quest of beauty,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where should he find it fairer than in Blanch?</div>
                              <div class="line">If zealous love should go in search of virtue,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where should he find it purer than in Blanch?</div>
                              <div class="line">If love ambitious sought a match of birth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose veins bound richer blood than Lady Blanch?</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as she is, in beauty, virtue, birth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is the young Dauphin every way complete:</div>
                              <div class="line">If not complete of, say he is not she;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she again wants nothing, to name want,</div>
                              <div class="line">If want it be not that she is not he:</div>
                              <div class="line">He is the half part of a blessed man,</div>
                              <div class="line">Left to be finished by such as she;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she a fair divided excellence,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose fulness of perfection lies in him.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, two such silver currents, when they join,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do glorify the banks that bound them in;</div>
                              <div class="line">And two such shores to two such streams made one,</div>
                              <div class="line">Two such controlling bounds shall you be, kings,</div>
                              <div class="line">To these two princes, if you marry them.</div>
                              <div class="line">This union shall do more than battery can</div>
                              <div class="line">To our fast-closed gates; for at this match,</div>
                              <div class="line">With swifter spleen than powder can enforce,</div>
                              <div class="line">The mouth of passage shall we fling wide ope,</div>
                              <div class="line">And give you entrance: but without this match,</div>
                              <div class="line">The sea enraged is not half so deaf,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lions more confident, mountains and rocks</div>
                              <div class="line">More free from motion, no, not Death himself</div>
                              <div class="line">In moral fury half so peremptory,</div>
                              <div class="line">As we to keep this city.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's a stay</div>
                              <div class="line">That shakes the rotten carcass of old Death</div>
                              <div class="line">Out of his rags! Here's a large mouth, indeed,</div>
                              <div class="line">That spits forth death and mountains, rocks and seas,</div>
                              <div class="line">Talks as familiarly of roaring lions</div>
                              <div class="line">As maids of thirteen do of puppy-dogs!</div>
                              <div class="line">What cannoneer begot this lusty blood?</div>
                              <div class="line">He speaks plain cannon fire, and smoke and bounce;</div>
                              <div class="line">He gives the bastinado with his tongue:</div>
                              <div class="line">Our ears are cudgell'd; not a word of his</div>
                              <div class="line">But buffets better than a fist of France:</div>
                              <div class="line">Zounds! I was never so bethump'd with words</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I first call'd my brother's father dad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">QUEEN ELINOR</div>
                              <div class="line">Son, list to this conjunction, make this match;</div>
                              <div class="line">Give with our niece a dowry large enough:</div>
                              <div class="line">For by this knot thou shalt so surely tie</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy now unsured assurance to the crown,</div>
                              <div class="line">That yon green boy shall have no sun to ripe</div>
                              <div class="line">The bloom that promiseth a mighty fruit.</div>
                              <div class="line">I see a yielding in the looks of France;</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark, how they whisper: urge them while their souls</div>
                              <div class="line">Are capable of this ambition,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest zeal, now melted by the windy breath</div>
                              <div class="line">Of soft petitions, pity and remorse,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cool and congeal again to what it was.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Citizen</div>
                              <div class="line">Why answer not the double majesties</div>
                              <div class="line">This friendly treaty of our threaten'd town?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak England first, that hath been forward first</div>
                              <div class="line">To speak unto this city: what say you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">If that the Dauphin there, thy princely son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Can in this book of beauty read 'I love,'</div>
                              <div class="line">Her dowry shall weigh equal with a queen:</div>
                              <div class="line">For Anjou and fair Touraine, Maine, Poictiers,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all that we upon this side the sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">Except this city now by us besieged,</div>
                              <div class="line">Find liable to our crown and dignity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall gild her bridal bed and make her rich</div>
                              <div class="line">In titles, honours and promotions,</div>
                              <div class="line">As she in beauty, education, blood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Holds hand with any princess of the world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">What say'st thou, boy? look in the lady's face.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">I do, my lord; and in her eye I find</div>
                              <div class="line">A wonder, or a wondrous miracle,</div>
                              <div class="line">The shadow of myself form'd in her eye:</div>
                              <div class="line">Which being but the shadow of your son,</div>
                              <div class="line">Becomes a sun and makes your son a shadow:</div>
                              <div class="line">I do protest I never loved myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Till now infixed I beheld myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Drawn in the flattering table of her eye.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Whispers with BLANCH</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Drawn in the flattering table of her eye!</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang'd in the frowning wrinkle of her brow!</div>
                              <div class="line">And quarter'd in her heart! he doth espy</div>
                              <div class="line">Himself love's traitor: this is pity now,</div>
                              <div class="line">That hang'd and drawn and quartered, there should be</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a love so vile a lout as he.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                              <div class="line">My uncle's will in this respect is mine:</div>
                              <div class="line">If he see aught in you that makes him like,</div>
                              <div class="line">That any thing he sees, which moves his liking,</div>
                              <div class="line">I can with ease translate it to my will;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or if you will, to speak more properly,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will enforce it easily to my love.</div>
                              <div class="line">Further I will not flatter you, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">That all I see in you is worthy love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than this; that nothing do I see in you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though churlish thoughts themselves should be your judge,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I can find should merit any hate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">What say these young ones? What say you my niece?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BLANCH</div>
                              <div class="line">That she is bound in honour still to do</div>
                              <div class="line">What you in wisdom still vouchsafe to say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak then, prince Dauphin; can you love this lady?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, ask me if I can refrain from love;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I do love her most unfeignedly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Then do I give Volquessen, Touraine, Maine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Poictiers and Anjou, these five provinces,</div>
                              <div class="line">With her to thee; and this addition more,</div>
                              <div class="line">Full thirty thousand marks of English coin.</div>
                              <div class="line">Philip of France, if thou be pleased withal,</div>
                              <div class="line">Command thy son and daughter to join hands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">It likes us well; young princes, close your hands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AUSTRIA</div>
                              <div class="line">And your lips too; for I am well assured</div>
                              <div class="line">That I did so when I was first assured.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, citizens of Angiers, ope your gates,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let in that amity which you have made;</div>
                              <div class="line">For at Saint Mary's chapel presently</div>
                              <div class="line">The rites of marriage shall be solemnized.</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not the Lady Constance in this troop?</div>
                              <div class="line">I know she is not, for this match made up</div>
                              <div class="line">Her presence would have interrupted much:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is she and her son? tell me, who knows.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">She is sad and passionate at your highness' tent.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING PHILIP</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by my faith, this league that we have made</div>
                              <div class="line">Will give her sadness very little cure.</div>
                              <div class="line">Brother of England, how may we content</div>
                              <div class="line">This widow lady? In her right we came;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which we, God knows, have turn'd another way,</div>
                              <div class="line">To our own vantage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">We will heal up all;</div>
                              <div class="line">For we'll create young Arthur Duke of Bretagne</div>
                              <div class="line">And Earl of Richmond; and this rich fair town</div>
                              <div class="line">We make him lord of. Call the Lady Constance;</div>
                              <div class="line">Some speedy messenger bid her repair</div>
                              <div class="line">To our solemnity: I trust we shall,</div>
                              <div class="line">If not fill up the measure of her will,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet in some measure satisfy her so</div>
                              <div class="line">That we shall stop her exclamation.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go we, as well as haste will suffer us,</div>
                              <div class="line">To this unlook'd for, unprepared pomp.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt all but the BASTARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Mad world! mad kings! mad composition!</div>
                              <div class="line">John, to stop Arthur's title in the whole,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath willingly departed with a part,</div>
                              <div class="line">And France, whose armour conscience buckled on,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom zeal and charity brought to the field</div>
                              <div class="line">As God's own soldier, rounded in the ear</div>
                              <div class="line">With that same purpose-changer, that sly devil,</div>
                              <div class="line">That broker, that still breaks the pate of faith,</div>
                              <div class="line">That daily break-vow, he that wins of all,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of kings, of beggars, old men, young men, maids,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, having no external thing to lose</div>
                              <div class="line">But the word 'maid,' cheats the poor maid of that,</div>
                              <div class="line">That smooth-faced gentleman, tickling Commodity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Commodity, the bias of the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">The world, who of itself is peised well,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made to run even upon even ground,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till this advantage, this vile-drawing bias,</div>
                              <div class="line">This sway of motion, this Commodity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Makes it take head from all indifferency,</div>
                              <div class="line">From all direction, purpose, course, intent:</div>
                              <div class="line">And this same bias, this Commodity,</div>
                              <div class="line">This bawd, this broker, this all-changing word,</div>
                              <div class="line">Clapp'd on the outward eye of fickle France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath drawn him from his own determined aid,</div>
                              <div class="line">From a resolved and honourable war,</div>
                              <div class="line">To a most base and vile-concluded peace.</div>
                              <div class="line">And why rail I on this Commodity?</div>
                              <div class="line">But for because he hath not woo'd me yet:</div>
