                              <div class="line">There's few or none do know me: if they did,</div>
                              <div class="line">This ship-boy's semblance hath disguised me quite.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am afraid; and yet I'll venture it.</div>
                              <div class="line">If I get down, and do not break my limbs,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll find a thousand shifts to get away:</div>
                              <div class="line">As good to die and go, as die and stay.</div>
                              <p>Leaps down</p>
                              <div class="line">O me! my uncle's spirit is in these stones:</div>
                              <div class="line">Heaven take my soul, and England keep my bones!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Dies</p>
                        <p>Enter PEMBROKE, SALISBURY, and BIGOT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, I will meet him at Saint Edmundsbury:</div>
                              <div class="line">It is our safety, and we must embrace</div>
                              <div class="line">This gentle offer of the perilous time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Who brought that letter from the cardinal?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">The Count Melun, a noble lord of France,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose private with me of the Dauphin's love</div>
                              <div class="line">Is much more general than these lines import.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow morning let us meet him then.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Or rather then set forward; for 'twill be</div>
                              <div class="line">Two long days' journey, lords, or ere we meet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the BASTARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Once more to-day well met, distemper'd lords!</div>
                              <div class="line">The king by me requests your presence straight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">The king hath dispossess'd himself of us:</div>
                              <div class="line">We will not line his thin bestained cloak</div>
                              <div class="line">With our pure honours, nor attend the foot</div>
                              <div class="line">That leaves the print of blood where'er it walks.</div>
                              <div class="line">Return and tell him so: we know the worst.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Whate'er you think, good words, I think, were best.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Our griefs, and not our manners, reason now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">But there is little reason in your grief;</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore 'twere reason you had manners now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, sir, impatience hath his privilege.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis true, to hurt his master, no man else.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the prison. What is he lies here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Seeing ARTHUR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">O death, made proud with pure and princely beauty!</div>
                              <div class="line">The earth had not a hole to hide this deed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Murder, as hating what himself hath done,</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth lay it open to urge on revenge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, when he doom'd this beauty to a grave,</div>
                              <div class="line">Found it too precious-princely for a grave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir Richard, what think you? have you beheld,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or have you read or heard? or could you think?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or do you almost think, although you see,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you do see? could thought, without this object,</div>
                              <div class="line">Form such another? This is the very top,</div>
                              <div class="line">The height, the crest, or crest unto the crest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of murder's arms: this is the bloodiest shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">The wildest savagery, the vilest stroke,</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever wall-eyed wrath or staring rage</div>
                              <div class="line">Presented to the tears of soft remorse.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">All murders past do stand excused in this:</div>
                              <div class="line">And this, so sole and so unmatchable,</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall give a holiness, a purity,</div>
                              <div class="line">To the yet unbegotten sin of times;</div>
                              <div class="line">And prove a deadly bloodshed but a jest,</div>
                              <div class="line">Exampled by this heinous spectacle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">It is a damned and a bloody work;</div>
                              <div class="line">The graceless action of a heavy hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">If that it be the work of any hand.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">If that it be the work of any hand!</div>
                              <div class="line">We had a kind of light what would ensue:</div>
                              <div class="line">It is the shameful work of Hubert's hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">The practise and the purpose of the king:</div>
                              <div class="line">From whose obedience I forbid my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">Kneeling before this ruin of sweet life,</div>
                              <div class="line">And breathing to his breathless excellence</div>
                              <div class="line">The incense of a vow, a holy vow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Never to taste the pleasures of the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">Never to be infected with delight,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor conversant with ease and idleness,</div>
                              <div class="line">Till I have set a glory to this hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">By giving it the worship of revenge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Our souls religiously confirm thy words.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter HUBERT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Lords, I am hot with haste in seeking you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Arthur doth live; the king hath sent for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">O, he is old and blushes not at death.</div>
                              <div class="line">Avaunt, thou hateful villain, get thee gone!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">I am no villain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Must I rob the law?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Drawing his sword</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Your sword is bright, sir; put it up again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Not till I sheathe it in a murderer's skin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand back, Lord Salisbury, stand back, I say;</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I think my sword's as sharp as yours:</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not have you, lord, forget yourself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor tempt the danger of my true defence;</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest I, by marking of your rage, forget</div>
                              <div class="line">Your worth, your greatness and nobility.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Out, dunghill! darest thou brave a nobleman?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Not for my life: but yet I dare defend</div>
                              <div class="line">My innocent life against an emperor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art a murderer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not prove me so;</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet I am none: whose tongue soe'er speaks false,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not truly speaks; who speaks not truly, lies.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Cut him to pieces.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Keep the peace, I say.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Stand by, or I shall gall you, Faulconbridge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou wert better gall the devil, Salisbury:</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou but frown on me, or stir thy foot,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or teach thy hasty spleen to do me shame,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll strike thee dead. Put up thy sword betime;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or I'll so maul you and your toasting-iron,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you shall think the devil is come from hell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">What wilt thou do, renowned Faulconbridge?</div>
                              <div class="line">Second a villain and a murderer?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord Bigot, I am none.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Who kill'd this prince?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not an hour since I left him well:</div>
                              <div class="line">I honour'd him, I loved him, and will weep</div>
                              <div class="line">My date of life out for his sweet life's loss.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Trust not those cunning waters of his eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">For villany is not without such rheum;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he, long traded in it, makes it seem</div>
                              <div class="line">Like rivers of remorse and innocency.</div>
                              <div class="line">Away with me, all you whose souls abhor</div>
                              <div class="line">The uncleanly savours of a slaughter-house;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I am stifled with this smell of sin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BIGOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Away toward Bury, to the Dauphin there!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">There tell the king he may inquire us out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Lords</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's a good world! Knew you of this fair work?</div>
                              <div class="line">Beyond the infinite and boundless reach</div>
                              <div class="line">Of mercy, if thou didst this deed of death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Art thou damn'd, Hubert.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Do but hear me, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Ha! I'll tell thee what;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou'rt damn'd as black--nay, nothing is so black;</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou art more deep damn'd than Prince Lucifer:</div>
                              <div class="line">There is not yet so ugly a fiend of hell</div>
                              <div class="line">As thou shalt be, if thou didst kill this child.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon my soul--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou didst but consent</div>
                              <div class="line">To this most cruel act, do but despair;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if thou want'st a cord, the smallest thread</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever spider twisted from her womb</div>
                              <div class="line">Will serve to strangle thee, a rush will be a beam</div>
                              <div class="line">To hang thee on; or wouldst thou drown thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Put but a little water in a spoon,</div>
                              <div class="line">And it shall be as all the ocean,</div>
                              <div class="line">Enough to stifle such a villain up.</div>
                              <div class="line">I do suspect thee very grievously.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">If I in act, consent, or sin of thought,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be guilty of the stealing that sweet breath</div>
                              <div class="line">Which was embounded in this beauteous clay,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let hell want pains enough to torture me.</div>
                              <div class="line">I left him well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, bear him in thine arms.</div>
                              <div class="line">I am amazed, methinks, and lose my way</div>
                              <div class="line">Among the thorns and dangers of this world.</div>
                              <div class="line">How easy dost thou take all England up!</div>
                              <div class="line">From forth this morsel of dead royalty,</div>
                              <div class="line">The life, the right and truth of all this realm</div>
                              <div class="line">Is fled to heaven; and England now is left</div>
                              <div class="line">To tug and scamble and to part by the teeth</div>
                              <div class="line">The unowed interest of proud-swelling state.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now for the bare-pick'd bone of majesty</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth dogged war bristle his angry crest</div>
                              <div class="line">And snarleth in the gentle eyes of peace:</div>
                              <div class="line">Now powers from home and discontents at home</div>
                              <div class="line">Meet in one line; and vast confusion waits,</div>
                              <div class="line">As doth a raven on a sick-fall'n beast,</div>
                              <div class="line">The imminent decay of wrested pomp.</div>
                              <div class="line">Now happy he whose cloak and cincture can</div>
                              <div class="line">Hold out this tempest. Bear away that child</div>
                              <div class="line">And follow me with speed: I'll to the king:</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand businesses are brief in hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">And heaven itself doth frown upon the land.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  KING JOHN'S palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.3">2. SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.4">3. SCENE III.  The field of battle.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.5">4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.6">5. SCENE V.  The French camp.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.7">6. SCENE VI.  An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.8">7. SCENE VII.  The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  KING JOHN'S palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter KING JOHN, CARDINAL PANDULPH, and Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus have I yielded up into your hand</div>
                              <div class="line">The circle of my glory.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Giving the crown</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Take again</div>
                              <div class="line">From this my hand, as holding of the pope</div>
                              <div class="line">Your sovereign greatness and authority.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Now keep your holy word: go meet the French,</div>
                              <div class="line">And from his holiness use all your power</div>
                              <div class="line">To stop their marches 'fore we are inflamed.</div>
                              <div class="line">Our discontented counties do revolt;</div>
                              <div class="line">Our people quarrel with obedience,</div>
                              <div class="line">Swearing allegiance and the love of soul</div>
                              <div class="line">To stranger blood, to foreign royalty.</div>
                              <div class="line">This inundation of mistemper'd humour</div>
                              <div class="line">Rests by you only to be qualified:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then pause not; for the present time's so sick,</div>
                              <div class="line">That present medicine must be minister'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or overthrow incurable ensues.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                              <div class="line">It was my breath that blew this tempest up,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon your stubborn usage of the pope;</div>
                              <div class="line">But since you are a gentle convertite,</div>
                              <div class="line">My tongue shall hush again this storm of war</div>
                              <div class="line">And make fair weather in your blustering land.</div>
                              <div class="line">On this Ascension-day, remember well,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon your oath of service to the pope,</div>
                              <div class="line">Go I to make the French lay down their arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this Ascension-day? Did not the prophet</div>
                              <div class="line">Say that before Ascension-day at noon</div>
                              <div class="line">My crown I should give off? Even so I have:</div>
                              <div class="line">I did suppose it should be on constraint:</div>
                              <div class="line">But, heaven be thank'd, it is but voluntary.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the BASTARD</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">All Kent hath yielded; nothing there holds out</div>
                              <div class="line">But Dover castle: London hath received,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a kind host, the Dauphin and his powers:</div>
                              <div class="line">Your nobles will not hear you, but are gone</div>
                              <div class="line">To offer service to your enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wild amazement hurries up and down</div>
                              <div class="line">The little number of your doubtful friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Would not my lords return to me again,</div>
                              <div class="line">After they heard young Arthur was alive?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">They found him dead and cast into the streets,</div>
                              <div class="line">An empty casket, where the jewel of life</div>
                              <div class="line">By some damn'd hand was robb'd and ta'en away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">That villain Hubert told me he did live.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">So, on my soul, he did, for aught he knew.</div>
                              <div class="line">But wherefore do you droop? why look you sad?</div>
                              <div class="line">Be great in act, as you have been in thought;</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not the world see fear and sad distrust</div>
                              <div class="line">Govern the motion of a kingly eye:</div>
                              <div class="line">Be stirring as the time; be fire with fire;</div>
                              <div class="line">Threaten the threatener and outface the brow</div>
                              <div class="line">Of bragging horror: so shall inferior eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">That borrow their behaviors from the great,</div>
                              <div class="line">Grow great by your example and put on</div>
                              <div class="line">The dauntless spirit of resolution.</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, and glister like the god of war,</div>
                              <div class="line">When he intendeth to become the field:</div>
                              <div class="line">Show boldness and aspiring confidence.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, shall they seek the lion in his den,</div>
                              <div class="line">And fright him there? and make him tremble there?</div>
                              <div class="line">O, let it not be said: forage, and run</div>
                              <div class="line">To meet displeasure farther from the doors,</div>
                              <div class="line">And grapple with him ere he comes so nigh.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">The legate of the pope hath been with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I have made a happy peace with him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And he hath promised to dismiss the powers</div>
                              <div class="line">Led by the Dauphin.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">O inglorious league!</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall we, upon the footing of our land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Send fair-play orders and make compromise,</div>
                              <div class="line">Insinuation, parley and base truce</div>
                              <div class="line">To arms invasive? shall a beardless boy,</div>
                              <div class="line">A cocker'd silken wanton, brave our fields,</div>
                              <div class="line">And flesh his spirit in a warlike soil,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mocking the air with colours idly spread,</div>
                              <div class="line">And find no cheque? Let us, my liege, to arms:</div>
                              <div class="line">Perchance the cardinal cannot make your peace;</div>
                              <div class="line">Or if he do, let it at least be said</div>
                              <div class="line">They saw we had a purpose of defence.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Have thou the ordering of this present time.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, then, with good courage! yet, I know,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our party may well meet a prouder foe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter, in arms, LEWIS, SALISBURY, MELUN, PEMBROKE,
BIGOT, and Soldiers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord Melun, let this be copied out,</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep it safe for our remembrance:</div>
                              <div class="line">Return the precedent to these lords again;</div>
                              <div class="line">That, having our fair order written down,</div>
                              <div class="line">Both they and we, perusing o'er these notes,</div>
                              <div class="line">May know wherefore we took the sacrament</div>
                              <div class="line">And keep our faiths firm and inviolable.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon our sides it never shall be broken.</div>
                              <div class="line">And, noble Dauphin, albeit we swear</div>
                              <div class="line">A voluntary zeal and an unurged faith</div>
                              <div class="line">To your proceedings; yet believe me, prince,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not glad that such a sore of time</div>
                              <div class="line">Should seek a plaster by contemn'd revolt,</div>
                              <div class="line">And heal the inveterate canker of one wound</div>
                              <div class="line">By making many. O, it grieves my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I must draw this metal from my side</div>
                              <div class="line">To be a widow-maker! O, and there</div>
                              <div class="line">Where honourable rescue and defence</div>
                              <div class="line">Cries out upon the name of Salisbury!</div>
                              <div class="line">But such is the infection of the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">That, for the health and physic of our right,</div>
                              <div class="line">We cannot deal but with the very hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Of stern injustice and confused wrong.</div>
                              <div class="line">And is't not pity, O my grieved friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">That we, the sons and children of this isle,</div>
                              <div class="line">Were born to see so sad an hour as this;</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein we step after a stranger march</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon her gentle bosom, and fill up</div>
                              <div class="line">Her enemies' ranks,--I must withdraw and weep</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the spot of this enforced cause,--</div>
                              <div class="line">To grace the gentry of a land remote,</div>
                              <div class="line">And follow unacquainted colours here?</div>
                              <div class="line">What, here? O nation, that thou couldst remove!</div>
                              <div class="line">That Neptune's arms, who clippeth thee about,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would bear thee from the knowledge of thyself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And grapple thee unto a pagan shore;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where these two Christian armies might combine</div>
                              <div class="line">The blood of malice in a vein of league,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not to spend it so unneighbourly!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">A noble temper dost thou show in this;</div>
                              <div class="line">And great affections wrestling in thy bosom</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth make an earthquake of nobility.</div>
                              <div class="line">O, what a noble combat hast thou fought</div>
                              <div class="line">Between compulsion and a brave respect!</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me wipe off this honourable dew,</div>
                              <div class="line">That silverly doth progress on thy cheeks:</div>
                              <div class="line">My heart hath melted at a lady's tears,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being an ordinary inundation;</div>
                              <div class="line">But this effusion of such manly drops,</div>
                              <div class="line">This shower, blown up by tempest of the soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">Startles mine eyes, and makes me more amazed</div>
                              <div class="line">Than had I seen the vaulty top of heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">Figured quite o'er with burning meteors.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lift up thy brow, renowned Salisbury,</div>
                              <div class="line">And with a great heart heave away the storm:</div>
                              <div class="line">Commend these waters to those baby eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">That never saw the giant world enraged;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor met with fortune other than at feasts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Full of warm blood, of mirth, of gossiping.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, come; for thou shalt thrust thy hand as deep</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the purse of rich prosperity</div>
                              <div class="line">As Lewis himself: so, nobles, shall you all,</div>
                              <div class="line">That knit your sinews to the strength of mine.</div>
                              <div class="line">And even there, methinks, an angel spake:</div>
                              <p>Enter CARDINAL PANDULPH</p>
                              <div class="line">Look, where the holy legate comes apace,</div>
                              <div class="line">To give us warrant from the hand of heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">And on our actions set the name of right</div>
                              <div class="line">With holy breath.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Hail, noble prince of France!</div>
                              <div class="line">The next is this, King John hath reconciled</div>
                              <div class="line">Himself to Rome; his spirit is come in,</div>
                              <div class="line">That so stood out against the holy church,</div>
                              <div class="line">The great metropolis and see of Rome:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore thy threatening colours now wind up;</div>
                              <div class="line">And tame the savage spirit of wild war,</div>
                              <div class="line">That like a lion foster'd up at hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">It may lie gently at the foot of peace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And be no further harmful than in show.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Your grace shall pardon me, I will not back:</div>
                              <div class="line">I am too high-born to be propertied,</div>
                              <div class="line">To be a secondary at control,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or useful serving-man and instrument,</div>
                              <div class="line">To any sovereign state throughout the world.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your breath first kindled the dead coal of wars</div>
                              <div class="line">Between this chastised kingdom and myself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And brought in matter that should feed this fire;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now 'tis far too huge to be blown out</div>
                              <div class="line">With that same weak wind which enkindled it.</div>
                              <div class="line">You taught me how to know the face of right,</div>
                              <div class="line">Acquainted me with interest to this land,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, thrust this enterprise into my heart;</div>
                              <div class="line">And come ye now to tell me John hath made</div>
                              <div class="line">His peace with Rome? What is that peace to me?</div>
                              <div class="line">I, by the honour of my marriage-bed,</div>
                              <div class="line">After young Arthur, claim this land for mine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, now it is half-conquer'd, must I back</div>
                              <div class="line">Because that John hath made his peace with Rome?</div>
                              <div class="line">Am I Rome's slave? What penny hath Rome borne,</div>
                              <div class="line">What men provided, what munition sent,</div>
                              <div class="line">To underprop this action? Is't not I</div>
                              <div class="line">That undergo this charge? who else but I,</div>
                              <div class="line">And such as to my claim are liable,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweat in this business and maintain this war?</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I not heard these islanders shout out</div>
                              <div class="line">'Vive le roi!' as I have bank'd their towns?</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I not here the best cards for the game,</div>
                              <div class="line">To win this easy match play'd for a crown?</div>
                              <div class="line">And shall I now give o'er the yielded set?</div>
                              <div class="line">No, no, on my soul, it never shall be said.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                              <div class="line">You look but on the outside of this work.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Outside or inside, I will not return</div>
                              <div class="line">Till my attempt so much be glorified</div>
                              <div class="line">As to my ample hope was promised</div>
                              <div class="line">Before I drew this gallant head of war,</div>
                              <div class="line">And cull'd these fiery spirits from the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">To outlook conquest and to win renown</div>
                              <div class="line">Even in the jaws of danger and of death.</div>
                              <p>Trumpet sounds</p>
                              <div class="line">What lusty trumpet thus doth summon us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter the BASTARD, attended</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">According to the fair play of the world,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me have audience; I am sent to speak:</div>
                              <div class="line">My holy lord of Milan, from the king</div>
                              <div class="line">I come, to learn how you have dealt for him;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, as you answer, I do know the scope</div>
                              <div class="line">And warrant limited unto my tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                              <div class="line">The Dauphin is too wilful-opposite,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will not temporize with my entreaties;</div>
                              <div class="line">He flatly says he'll not lay down his arms.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">By all the blood that ever fury breathed,</div>
                              <div class="line">The youth says well. Now hear our English king;</div>
                              <div class="line">For thus his royalty doth speak in me.</div>
                              <div class="line">He is prepared, and reason too he should:</div>
                              <div class="line">This apish and unmannerly approach,</div>
                              <div class="line">This harness'd masque and unadvised revel,</div>
                              <div class="line">This unhair'd sauciness and boyish troops,</div>
                              <div class="line">The king doth smile at; and is well prepared</div>
                              <div class="line">To whip this dwarfish war, these pigmy arms,</div>
                              <div class="line">From out the circle of his territories.</div>
                              <div class="line">That hand which had the strength, even at your door,</div>
                              <div class="line">To cudgel you and make you take the hatch,</div>
                              <div class="line">To dive like buckets in concealed wells,</div>
                              <div class="line">To crouch in litter of your stable planks,</div>
                              <div class="line">To lie like pawns lock'd up in chests and trunks,</div>
                              <div class="line">To hug with swine, to seek sweet safety out</div>
                              <div class="line">In vaults and prisons, and to thrill and shake</div>
                              <div class="line">Even at the crying of your nation's crow,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thinking his voice an armed Englishman;</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall that victorious hand be feebled here,</div>
                              <div class="line">That in your chambers gave you chastisement?</div>
                              <div class="line">No: know the gallant monarch is in arms</div>
                              <div class="line">And like an eagle o'er his aery towers,</div>
                              <div class="line">To souse annoyance that comes near his nest.</div>
                              <div class="line">And you degenerate, you ingrate revolts,</div>
                              <div class="line">You bloody Neroes, ripping up the womb</div>
                              <div class="line">Of your dear mother England, blush for shame;</div>
                              <div class="line">For your own ladies and pale-visaged maids</div>
                              <div class="line">Like Amazons come tripping after drums,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their thimbles into armed gauntlets change,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their needles to lances, and their gentle hearts</div>
                              <div class="line">To fierce and bloody inclination.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">There end thy brave, and turn thy face in peace;</div>
                              <div class="line">We grant thou canst outscold us: fare thee well;</div>
                              <div class="line">We hold our time too precious to be spent</div>
                              <div class="line">With such a brabbler.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">CARDINAL PANDULPH</div>
                              <div class="line">Give me leave to speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">No, I will speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">We will attend to neither.</div>
                              <div class="line">Strike up the drums; and let the tongue of war</div>
                              <div class="line">Plead for our interest and our being here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed your drums, being beaten, will cry out;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so shall you, being beaten: do but start</div>
                              <div class="line">An echo with the clamour of thy drum,</div>
                              <div class="line">And even at hand a drum is ready braced</div>
                              <div class="line">That shall reverberate all as loud as thine;</div>
                              <div class="line">Sound but another, and another shall</div>
                              <div class="line">As loud as thine rattle the welkin's ear</div>
                              <div class="line">And mock the deep-mouth'd thunder: for at hand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not trusting to this halting legate here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom he hath used rather for sport than need</div>
                              <div class="line">Is warlike John; and in his forehead sits</div>
                              <div class="line">A bare-ribb'd death, whose office is this day</div>
                              <div class="line">To feast upon whole thousands of the French.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Strike up our drums, to find this danger out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASTARD</div>
                              <div class="line">And thou shalt find it, Dauphin, do not doubt.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  The field of battle.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Alarums. Enter KING JOHN and HUBERT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">How goes the day with us? O, tell me, Hubert.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">HUBERT</div>
                              <div class="line">Badly, I fear. How fares your majesty?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">This fever, that hath troubled me so long,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lies heavy on me; O, my heart is sick!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord, your valiant kinsman, Faulconbridge,</div>
                              <div class="line">Desires your majesty to leave the field</div>
                              <div class="line">And send him word by me which way you go.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him, toward Swinstead, to the abbey there.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Be of good comfort; for the great supply</div>
                              <div class="line">That was expected by the Dauphin here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are wreck'd three nights ago on Goodwin Sands.</div>
                              <div class="line">This news was brought to Richard but even now:</div>
                              <div class="line">The French fight coldly, and retire themselves.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">KING JOHN</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay me! this tyrant fever burns me up,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will not let me welcome this good news.</div>
                              <div class="line">Set on toward Swinstead: to my litter straight;</div>
                              <div class="line">Weakness possesseth me, and I am faint.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SALISBURY, PEMBROKE, and BIGOT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">I did not think the king so stored with friends.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Up once again; put spirit in the French:</div>
                              <div class="line">If they miscarry, we miscarry too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">That misbegotten devil, Faulconbridge,</div>
                              <div class="line">In spite of spite, alone upholds the day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">They say King John sore sick hath left the field.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter MELUN, wounded</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MELUN</div>
                              <div class="line">Lead me to the revolts of England here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">When we were happy we had other names.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PEMBROKE</div>
                              <div class="line">It is the Count Melun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">Wounded to death.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MELUN</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly, noble English, you are bought and sold;</div>
                              <div class="line">Unthread the rude eye of rebellion</div>
                              <div class="line">And welcome home again discarded faith.</div>
                              <div class="line">Seek out King John and fall before his feet;</div>
                              <div class="line">For if the French be lords of this loud day,</div>
                              <div class="line">He means to recompense the pains you take</div>
                              <div class="line">By cutting off your heads: thus hath he sworn</div>
                              <div class="line">And I with him, and many moe with me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the altar at Saint Edmundsbury;</div>
                              <div class="line">Even on that altar where we swore to you</div>
                              <div class="line">Dear amity and everlasting love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">May this be possible? may this be true?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MELUN</div>
                              <div class="line">Have I not hideous death within my view,</div>
                              <div class="line">Retaining but a quantity of life,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which bleeds away, even as a form of wax</div>
                              <div class="line">Resolveth from his figure 'gainst the fire?</div>
                              <div class="line">What in the world should make me now deceive,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I must lose the use of all deceit?</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should I then be false, since it is true</div>
                              <div class="line">That I must die here and live hence by truth?</div>
                              <div class="line">I say again, if Lewis do win the day,</div>
                              <div class="line">He is forsworn, if e'er those eyes of yours</div>
                              <div class="line">Behold another day break in the east:</div>
                              <div class="line">But even this night, whose black contagious breath</div>
                              <div class="line">Already smokes about the burning crest</div>
                              <div class="line">Of the old, feeble and day-wearied sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even this ill night, your breathing shall expire,</div>
                              <div class="line">Paying the fine of rated treachery</div>
                              <div class="line">Even with a treacherous fine of all your lives,</div>
                              <div class="line">If Lewis by your assistance win the day.</div>
                              <div class="line">Commend me to one Hubert with your king:</div>
                              <div class="line">The love of him, and this respect besides,</div>
                              <div class="line">For that my grandsire was an Englishman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Awakes my conscience to confess all this.</div>
                              <div class="line">In lieu whereof, I pray you, bear me hence</div>
                              <div class="line">From forth the noise and rumour of the field,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where I may think the remnant of my thoughts</div>
                              <div class="line">In peace, and part this body and my soul</div>
                              <div class="line">With contemplation and devout desires.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALISBURY</div>
                              <div class="line">We do believe thee: and beshrew my soul</div>
                              <div class="line">But I do love the favour and the form</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this most fair occasion, by the which</div>
                              <div class="line">We will untread the steps of damned flight,</div>
                              <div class="line">And like a bated and retired flood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Leaving our rankness and irregular course,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stoop low within those bounds we have o'erlook'd</div>
                              <div class="line">And cabby run on in obedience</div>
                              <div class="line">Even to our ocean, to our great King John.</div>
                              <div class="line">My arm shall give thee help to bear thee hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I do see the cruel pangs of death</div>
                              <div class="line">Right in thine eye. Away, my friends! New flight;</div>
                              <div class="line">And happy newness, that intends old right.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt, leading off MELUN</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  The French camp.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LEWIS and his train</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">The sun of heaven methought was loath to set,</div>
                              <div class="line">But stay'd and made the western welkin blush,</div>
                              <div class="line">When English measure backward their own ground</div>
                              <div class="line">In faint retire. O, bravely came we off,</div>
                              <div class="line">When with a volley of our needless shot,</div>
                              <div class="line">After such bloody toil, we bid good night;</div>
                              <div class="line">And wound our tattering colours clearly up,</div>
                              <div class="line">Last in the field, and almost lords of it!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Messenger</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is my prince, the Dauphin?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Here: what news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">The Count Melun is slain; the English lords</div>
                              <div class="line">By his persuasion are again fall'n off,</div>
                              <div class="line">And your supply, which you have wish'd so long,</div>
                              <div class="line">Are cast away and sunk on Goodwin Sands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Ah, foul shrewd news! beshrew thy very heart!</div>
                              <div class="line">I did not think to be so sad to-night</div>
                              <div class="line">As this hath made me. Who was he that said</div>
                              <div class="line">King John did fly an hour or two before</div>
                              <div class="line">The stumbling night did part our weary powers?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Messenger</div>
                              <div class="line">Whoever spoke it, it is true, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LEWIS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well; keep good quarter and good care to-night:</div>
                              <div class="line">The day shall not be up so soon as I,</div>
                              <div class="line">To try the fair adventure of to-morrow.</div>
